Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring”
Reviews.Author: AlecTurner
Reviews.Content: Clean, cheap mini bar, reasonable restaurant, friendly and helpful staff. Take tea bags and blister repair for the walking.

Reviews.Title: “Close to most sites with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: nancymay
Reviews.Content: We visited in mid March for the rugby. The hotel was very central for everything we wanted. We walked everywhere except to the Stadium when we took the bus for 1 euro. The breakfast was substantial and had everything we required. There was a machine for coffee but, if you asked, the waiting staff would make cappuchino or espresso to order. My only problem was the bed, it was too hard and the pillows too thin.Guiseppe on the front desk was very helpful and knowledgable about the city. He also tried not to gloat when his team beat us on the Saturday! Overall a very positive experience and I would certainly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff, room, price,the breakfast, all great!”
Reviews.Author: WorldBirderMichigan_
Reviews.Content: Ok to be picky, there wasn't a holder for soap in the shower. That is the only problem with this place, everything else was excellent! We stayed three nights to tour the sights of Rome and could walk easily to the Forum, Pantheon, Colosseum, Trajan's Market, only the Vatican was a little distant but we took the Subway easily from the hotel and walked home. I expected Rome to be noisy and the first night our room was a little noisy but the bed was so comfortable and the room so nice we hesitated to change. We did request a quieter room and the staff obliged without hesitation and the room (and bed) were again excellent! The breakfast was much better than expected, all types of pastries, fresh fruit, coffees, tea, juice, scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, cheeses, etc. We hope we can return to Rome and we would definitely want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, friendly staff, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Don B
Reviews.Content: We picked this location because of how central it was to all the sites we wanted to see. It turned out to be much more convenient than we though! The hotel is located in very close walking distance to The Colosseum, Fountain of Trevi, and the Spanish Steps. Alessandro helped us get settled in and was a great help in making reccomendations for local restaurants. Not only was he friendly, but he went out of his way to help us! I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: S S
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we have stayed at in Rome. We had a quadruple room which was spacious, clean and warm enough to need the windows open if we returned during the day. Breakfast was a good selection and plenty of it. We had no trouble with noise from either the road or other guests. The staff were friendly and helpful which is something we have not experienced in other hotels. Easy walking distance to all sights and restaurants. Will definately stay here if we return. The only downside of visiting Rome is the cost of food and drink in the main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jj30
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in February, it is a fantastic hotel in a brilliant location. The staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast provided a good buffet choice and the rooms, albiet small, were clean and had everything necessary for a comfortable stay. The hotel is centrally located for the main sights. A 5-10 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum and the main shopping area. The Pantheon and the Spanish steps about a 15 minute walk. We walked to the hotel from the train station and it was easy to find, using the directions on the hotels website.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Margrove
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. Emailed beforehand to advise it was our honeymoon and we were upgraded to a mini suite complete with private terrace! Bed was comfortable, bathroom clean with jacuzzi. Breakfast was the usual buffet of rolls, jams, cereals, selection of cold meats and cheeses plus hot scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage - again buffet style. All staff we came into contact with we're friendly. Hotel is 10 mins walk from the Trevi fountain. Slightly further to Coloseum. All main sights are easily walkable though - including the Vatican which took us about 45 mins or so. Rome really is amazing but it's a city and the prices reflect that. Expect to pay (in euros), 10 for pizza / pasta dish, 6-8 for a glass of wine or beer (cheaper or about the same to order a bottle of wine as it is to buy two glasses). There are deals to be found however - especially so if you take yourself away from the main tourist traps and explore it little. 3 nights was just enough to see the main sights but anyone with an interest in history, art or just wants to explore at a less frenetic pace would be better at av4 or 5 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “location is great and hotel very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MCSII_Trav-e-ler
Reviews.Content: just came back from rome. rome is beautifull but it seems like all the city is under construction. the hotel hiberia is a quiet and peacefull place to start and end your day. the room is quite small and at times too warm, but the beds are very comfortable and breakfest is great. staff was helpfull when asked. the location is just great. walking distance from every major attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room. Good location. Unfriendly staff. Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Colton B
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, but that is about it. It is near the top of the hill, so anytime you leave you will be walking back uphill. The breakfast is ok. Room was decent size, but right on the street so we could hear Italians yelling at each other all night. The staff seemed uninterested in helping us find our way to anything. They would merely mark our map with an x, and leave it to us as to which direction to head and how to get there. Any requests we made were met with annoyed faces and snarky attitudes, which seemed to be a theme in Rome amongst any employee anywhere. Their website boasts WIFI and a LAN connection, but they only allow one person in your room to be on at a time, and the reception is awful. We definitely wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “it was o.k”
Reviews.Author: yael t
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Located in the center of the city; very close to helpful bus stations but the street is very noisy and the hotel is not intimate or having a special design. Ask for a quiet room

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carroll c
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a great area. Walking distance to the Presidential Palace, Trevis fountain and Spanish steps to name a few. The Hotel was beautiful and the staff were great. To names that stick out are Joseph and Dino. Both spoke English and were more than happy to do what they could to make us comfortable. They helped us with directions and were so welcoming. I would stay there again. Breakfast was bountiful and the coffee was great. I do not remember all the people names that we interacted with but all were nice and polite. I enjoyed the hotel because it was not a chain hotel so it had its own ambience and fit in with the buildings around it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location. Air con/heating spoilt it for us.”
Reviews.Author: treacleMerseyside
Reviews.Content: Firstly, great location. Everything within walking distance. Good breakfast 7am-10am. We missed it 2 out of 3 mornings by 10 mins. 10.30am would've suited us. Room very clean, bedding and towels too. Towels changed daily. Wonderful hot shower albeit terrible botch up job with sealant around the shower! We had room 216. Small but adequate. Absolutely no view other than the hotel's heating and water pipes which constantly gushed and clanked - not good during the night. We aren't bothered by a terrible view but what we did struggle with was the air con is turned to permanently blow hot air from November onwards. In such a small room right by the heating pipes we were absolutely sweltering. Fortunately the windows opened to allow a little draft but the heat was to much and made for very uncomfortable nights sleep. When we mentioned to reception they just shrugged. The other sleep disturber is the noisy hotel staff. Woke us every morning shouting to each other, slamming doors. The hotel bar did not suit us as no whisky, southern comfort, lemonade but i think they did have beer. The heat and noise did spoil our stay at this hotel but I suspect from reading other reviews we have just been unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Three Days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MickyCeee
Reviews.Content: The hotel may NOT be so pretty on the outside BUT the inside is BEAUTIFUL!!! Two of the front staff whom we dealt with, Raffale & Alex were ABSOLUTELY PERFECT in every way!!! Spoke English perfectly, knew ALL the ways to get somewhere, (AND BACK), as accomodating as you WANT someone to be and could NOT be ANY friendlier!!! The rooms were very nice, good views out the windows and BATHROOMS in the rooms. The prices were average for a centrally located hotel in Rome. I found that if you booked later to your trip, you could save a LOT more $. I, :o( ,booked earlier and paid the premium. Booking.com did NOT live up to thier promise to match a lower rate @ same time/hotel. Oh well, you live & learn!!! Out of five *s, Hiberia gets ALL five!!! Oct 25-28 2011

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: messro
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Hiberia. It's located just steps away from the Piazza del Quirinale (one of the seven hills) with a view of the Vatican, off Via Nazionale - a main bus route, and about 2 blocks from the Piazza Venezia and the Vittorio Emanuele Monument. A great loacation! I had to switch rooms due to a plumbing problem, both rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The first room was part of a 2 room apt/suite with a shared bathroom, a great layout for a family. The second room was above the front door but very quiet. Breakfast included was satisfying. Dino at the front desk was the best, he helped with tours, transportation, directions and recommendations. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: KakiDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was large and clean, the desk service was excellent with great recommendations for walking tours and restaurants, and the location was quiet. The hotel is midway between the ancient Rome sites and Trevi Fountain so we did all of our sightseeing on foot. Breakfast was excellent. In addition to the standard bread, cheese, coffee fare our breakfast also included scrambled eggs and sausage - a rarity in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: GSHpointer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three nights at Hotel Hiberia before going on a cruise. Being our first time in Europe we really didn't know what to expect from this or any hotel for that matter. We found Hotel Hiberia to be very clean, comfortable, and conveniently located. We were able to easily walk to all the popular attractions from this location. The gentlemen at the front desk were friendly and very helpful in helping us track down our missing luggage that the airlines had misplaced. Breakfast was not fancy but included scrambled eggs, meats, cheeses, pastries, fruits, cereals, and many beverage choices. It was all we needed to start our morning in Rome. On our next visit to Rome we definitely would stay at Hotel Hiberia again. Scott & Veronica Rife

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: memaa4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hiberia. Our room was lovely and comfortable and centrally located. We had plenty of room for our luggage & clothing. The front desk people were wonderful...all very happy to help & recommend places to eat & shop. They called our cabs for us when we needed, arranged for a van to take us to the airport when we left. Would highly recommend Hotel Hiberia.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel, mostly friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen N
Reviews.Content: Just got done with 8 nights in Italy. First 4 in Rome and second for in Florence. Hotel Hiberia is a good location. Short walk to Trevi fountain, and many squares. People at the front desk were very nice and very helpful. English was very good, Women in the breakfast dining area were rude, unfriendly and unwelcoming. The room decor was good and charming.

Reviews.Title: “fab location, rubbish breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: mrsaliN
Reviews.Content: Loved the feel of the place, really cool in the August heat. Had a great 2 room suite b(for 2 adults, 2 kids aged 7 & 6) on top floor with nice big clean bathroom, comfy beds and a lovely little roof terrace. Good value for what was on offer and for location - easy walk to restaurants, forum and colliseum. Breakfast terrible though! Not even a proper cup of coffee ;-(

Reviews.Title: “Good location and bathroom is clean”
Reviews.Author: MamaGlovestoeat
Reviews.Content: Can walk to everywhere, tervi fountain, Spanish steps, coliseum, etc. The room is too warm for hubby, but I am fine with it. Wi Fi is only 5 euros for the whole stay not per night!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: Kimkam26
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy and Rome so I wasn't sure what to expect from the hotels. I found this one to be a pleasant surprise. I was with a friend so we requested a room with 2 twin beds which was provided. The room was small as are most European hotel rooms, but we managed. We had a stand up shower only, no bath, and the shower did tend to flood the bathroom floor no matter how careful we were so we used our towels to mop things up. We got fresh towels every day though. It had a hair dryer that worked well, so I was glad I hadn't wasted space packing one. We were on the 4th floor, through one of the hall doorways then down a hall. We were confused the first few times up and down, but finally figured it out. They served the included breakfast from 7-10 in a separate breakfast room. It was more substantial then I expected (having only been to France and given just croissants for breakfast). There were scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon. Fresh salami and cheeses, sweet breads, delicious yogurts and cereals. The coffee was from a push button machine and not too good. That was surprising. Other then that, I found the breakfast adequate to start the day off sightseeing. The location was very good, not hard to find and centrally located and within walking distance to a lot of the major sites. There was a metro station not far away if you wanted to get to other areas farther away. The front desk staff spoke pretty good English and we had no trouble communicating. They were helpful when we asked questions and ordered us a taxi to the train station the morning we departed. We paid $232 (American) per night for our room.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dublinguber
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nights in this hotel in september after a cruise. when we arrived at hotel it was a full 5 min before the man on the desk even looked at us. the room was to the front of the hotel , the bed was clean but when i went to have a shower the shower head was being held up with a toothpick!! when i tried to use the hairdryer the tube which was attached came away .there where a lot of ants on the bedroom floor and when i told them at the front desk a man came up and sprayed what looked like water and wiped them away, they where back within the hour. breakfast basic. this hotel cost 250 euro for 2 nights and i think you could do much better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Central to the task”
Reviews.Author: neoprene
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all my needs and more.. Being a single traveler it is always good to have hotel staff that offer the friendly face. Here they did that in spades. The Hiberia is well located within walking distance of most sights. Rome really is a city of walking as the sites are closer than the map makes you think. My room was fine. It wasn't luxurious but it was comfortable, clean and small..Breakfast was more than adequate, in fact I would call it generous..

Reviews.Title: “Just keep that wondow open...”
Reviews.Author: nokkla
Reviews.Content: The major thing I remember about our hotel was the unbearable heat in our room. Heating could not be switched off and we had to keep our window open 24-hours in search of some fresh air in mid-December! Our room faced a service shaft, but at least we could keep open for some fresh air. Location was great just a corner away from the Quirinale, Altare della Patria and nearby both Fontana di Trevi and Colosseo. Breakfast was ok except for the terrible coffee from the machine, which you would not expect in Rome. Room was fine including bath with Jacuzzi. Safe, clean and central, and that’s what always matters for us. The hotel is anexxed to an old palazzo with some rooms in the older building (quite common especially in Italy), but you still get a very safe feeling. We visited the place at a very special time for us, our engagement at the Vatican so I cherish our stay in Rome. I would recommend a stay there. All the basics are in place, pricing is adequate and staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Room 125”
Reviews.Author: sharkyfs
Reviews.Content: The real downside to this hotel is the above room. Their is no natural light during the day & it stank of cigarette smoke. Unfortunately there were no other rooms available. The bathroom is small as long as you don't mind wandering down the corridor at night for a "break", it is your own personal roo though. The bathroom also smells quite badly, stale water & worse. The shower is fine! There is no chair for using the dressing table, not enough room, the bed is all you have? Although not the be all & end all there are over 100 channels on the TV but only BBC World News & CNN in English & no signal for the other digital channels (80+). Many of these comments have been duplicated in other reviews & so the hotel has not taken heed of them? On the upside it is in walking distance of about every major sight.

Reviews.Title: “BAD experience”
Reviews.Author: Orijit
Reviews.Content: AC broke down . Water dripped on our back from the overhead flush. Good location. But I will never go back and never recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JA1403
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Hiberia last week for one night for a brief visit to Rome – would definitely recommend as the location is great for the sights , the hotel was clean, beds comfortable, Air conditioning effective and not noisy, receptionists very helpful and welcoming so overall great value for money . Minibar prices were reasonable too so you don’t mind using it if you are only paying 2-3 Euros for a water, beer or juice. The added bonus for us is that we booked a double room and were allocated a family room with two bedrooms, ensuite and a balcony / terrace area.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel-things to watch!”
Reviews.Author: Gideon B
Reviews.Content: Good prime location modest hotel with OLD and NEW parts.Make sure you choose the NEWER part Rooms are nice but small IMPORTANT:not all have an adjoining bath!This is not clear from the web site.. Manager was kind enough to offer a free upgrade to their next block hotel which I did not like.Staff were very patient with me(Gino and Joseph-Thanks) Gideon

Reviews.Title: “Hiberia Hotel, Great location and a very nice Hotel with Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: EmZee21
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Hiberia in Rome for 3nights(Aug 7th,-10 )on a recommendation from a friend!We booked far in advance w-payment.We drove from Florence and found our Hotel easily,From Mrs Garman(gps,quite recommended) Dino at the front desk was very nice .We got our room which had a broken shower door, they tried hard in fixing it.Between that and our not so good a view,Dino said he could note for a room change for the A M, which did happen very easily too.Our new room was just great, beautiful with a great view and we were very happy!Location of this hotel was Great, close to Everything,easily walkable to all the Sites! They serve a great Breakfast too!We also got a restaurant recommendation from the Hotel which was the same mentioned from the last reviewers from LA and I must say that was really nice, the people were very nice ,friendly and we found the food to be very good.My wife was happy with their house white wine while I asked for a little taste of the House red which I didn't like(I do feel house wine can be hit or miss and no problemo) so I just ordered a half bottle! We liked the food enough to return a 2nd time before leaving and received a discount for returning!Also at the Colosseum, we quickly found a tour to hook up with for a bit extra and avoided the lines and had a great experience which also covered touring Palatine Hill and the Forum, look for those tour people walking around! Over-all had a Great time in Rome and would Highly Recommend the Hiberia Hotel to all...A Great helpful staff oh and We got to park our Rental right in front of the Hiberia for the 3 nights at no Charge! Then off to Wine country of Tuscany!!!! Cheers to all going !

Reviews.Title: “Didn't except 2 rooms for us family of 4, great result!”
Reviews.Author: KirstM
Reviews.Content: They were friendly, close to everything in Rome, we walked everywhere from the hotel with our 10 year old and 14 year old! Breakfast good, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hiberia Very Central Location walking distant to all of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cloonacool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a quick city break. This hotel is very centrally located to all of Romes main sights. This is a very reasonably priced hotel compared to other hotels in Rome. The room was clean and we had it was ensuite. We had a great view out of our room too. The rooms were a bit old but adequate. The staff were a case of two extremes. Raphael one of the guys on the door was the friendliest and most helpfully person I have ever come across working in a hotel. He was fantastic throughout our stay and couldn't have been more helpful. The second person working was the rudest person I ever came across I think his dad must own the hotel or something there is no way any hotel would hire this guy. There was a really old fashioned lift that was very cool too. The breakfast was really great here too there was as much eggs, cold meats, cereals and bread that you could eat. There was also a room to keep luggage when we checked out. All in all this was a good hotel and I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaQRostrevor
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location as we were only staying in Rome for 3 days and wanted to see all the key attractions. Location was indeed superb - easy walk to Colosseum, Trevi and Spanish Steps and very handy to the No 40 bus to the Vatican. We had booked a quad room and were given effectively a suite (Room 425) with 2 bedrooms, a decent bathroom and a terrace by Raphael at reception. He was fantastic throughout our short stay and couldn't have been more helpful. We loved the old-fashioned lift. Breakfast was fine, with eggs, cold meats, cereals etc and it set us up well for an exhausting day sight-seeing! My tip for Rome - prebooking tickets for Vatican (www.vatican.va) and Colosseum before you go is highly recommended - fantastic to walk to the front of the queue. Also the 3rd floor and underground tour of Colosseum was well worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice room, very good breakfast and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jeyess
Reviews.Content: Pay a little extra and get a very good hotel in the heart of Rome. We had a quad room with our own balcony and ejoyed it tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for seeing all of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ADublinTraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hiberia was ideally located for seeing all the major sights in Rome. It was a 5-10 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Venezia, Colesseum & Roman Forum and well connected by bus to Termini Station and the Vatican (Bus no 64 or 40 express). The hotel is located just off the Via Nazionale which is full of shops, cafes etc. We had a standard double room with a lovey view of the Roman Forum and all the rooftops of Rome. It was a little noisy outside so if you left your window open you may not sleep but we were so tired from a days sightseeing that it wasnt a problem for us. Our room had air con too which was much needed as it was 26 degrees out! Our room was cleaned and towels changed every day. The guys on the reception desk were very helpful with any of our queries and check in and check out were very efficient. The breakfast room was lovely and served a good selection of pastries, toast, jams, cold meats, cheeses, cereals etc. If you're getting the bus anywhere in Rome you must purchase a bus ticket for 1euro before getting on the bus, as you cannot pay cash to the driver. You can get the tickets in any tobacconists. Get to the Vatican early to avoid the queues or else go with a tourguide which can bypass the queue but you will pay a little extra for this privilege. it is well worth it though, our guide was fantastic. We went to the Colesseum in the evening, 1 hour before closing time which was great as the crowds had gone and it was beautiful during the sunset. Anyone wishing to go up to see the Olympic Stadium to see an A.S. Roma football game, you get the 910 bus from Termini Station but you get your match tickets from the club shop which is in the Piazza Colonna (off the Via del Corso). You must bring your passport with you to obtain a ticket, and also to the game. Eating out in Rome was expensive in the main piazzas like Piazza Navona, so i would advise anyone to go to the little side streets off these piazzas where you will find traditional family run Trattorias which are better value and the food is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: April_Mexico_bride
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Hotel Hiberia. The location is simply perfect for site-seeing (seriously, the great location cannot be overstated), and very convenient to the train station (10 minutes by express bus #40). The hotel is charming and the staff very attentive and helpful. Breakfast is very good, with more choice than most hotels we had in Italy. They even had hard-bolied eggs. Our room was small, but we had chosen the double room with external bathroom so we expected a small room and it suited our needs very well. The bedroom and bathroom were clean and maid service came daily, as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Rabih193
Reviews.Content: First the rooms were very small, they only changed our bed sheets once throughout our stay and just because we asked them to because the first one had stains and hair on it, the bathroom was okay but they didn't clean it at all, they only gave us shower gel, no shampoo and at the end they wanted to charge us for something we got from outside as a mini bar and we experience a blackout in our room for almost an hour. The building is residential with few floors turned into the hotel, the breakfast buffet was awful, it lacked variety and not to mention that you have to get everything yourself from forks to salt and pepper. The only good thing about the hotel was its location.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: Fianna37
Reviews.Content: A bit far from the train station, but an easy walk if you take Natzionale. Hotel staff, especially Rafael are really friendly and helpful. Loved the old time elevator with double doors to close and loved that they brought up our luggage for us and showed us how all the light switches worked! Versace tiles throughout the room were amazing, as was the architecture without our room. Crown molding and soft color scheme. Truly beautiful! Very close to all the major tourist spots; Trevi Fountain, Coliseum, etc. And they know all the local bus routes for the further sites like the Vatican. Really a pleasant and wonderful experience. And a nice spread for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aslam87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Hiberia for 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location - short walking distance to Trevi fountain and Colesseum. In fact we walked to all the different tourist attractions. We stayed in the double room with an external bathroom, which I would not recommend opting for. Small room! and the bathroom is further down the corridor. Although, you do not share it with other people, it's not very convenient. We opted for double and it was made up of 2 single beds pushed together. The pillows were very flat and uncomfortable. We paid £232 for 3 nights which included breakfast.. There was a good selection for breakfast, made up of pastries, cereals, toast, selection of meats and the fried stuff - bacon, egg, frankfurter sausage. The juices available tasted more like squash unfortunately. Staff were friendly and helpful. There was a room to keep luggage when you checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustig
Reviews.Content: We got a (low-season) deal of 5 nights for 430€ incl breakfast. Location is excellent and we had asked for a quiet room, which the hotel duly gave us. The food at breakfast was good to excellent, but the drinks sub-standard: the fruit juice is fruit squash and the coffee from a machine was barely drinkable – a great disappointment in Italy. Most staff are helpful and some are cheerful as well. The criticism of the lift in other reviews is, to my mind, unjustified; be glad the lift-shaft is well away from rooms, unlike many hotels where rooms adjacent to the lift get a lot of noise and inconvenience.. We were delighted to be allowed to check-in online for our return flight using the computer at reception and we also used the hotel’s offer to book a taxi transfer to the airport – the driver got us to the airport in half an hour, but it’s not a journey I remember with any pleasure; consider using orangelimosrome.com instead.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great. Hotel is descent.”
Reviews.Author: sandy8978
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a pretty good value. The best thing it has going is its location. You can pretty much walk to any of the sites. Its about a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and 5-10 to the Trevi Fountain. It is nowhere near a metro line so if you are looking to have good train access this isnt the place for you. We didnt take the bus so Im not sure about the bus stops. The accomodations were descent. We traveled with 3 children and were allowed to stay in a quadruple and they had no problem allowing my 3 year old to stay free with the existing bedding. That was great since a room for 5 is very hard to find in Europe. The shower in our room was terrible. Our was a hand held sprayer that you had to hold it couldnt be left on the wall or it would spray straight out into the bathroom. They have a 2 paneled glass door to the shower which doesnt surround the tub completely so water gets everywhere. The elevator to get to the room is a very old cage elevator. Its a little scary at first but we didnt have any problems. The staff was very friendly except for one man ( not sure of his name) . It seemed like we were bothering him with anything we needed. The internet wasnt working in the rooms when we checked in.We checked in on Sunday and he said it would be up by the next day. Tuesday night at 9pm the internet finally worked. He let us use the computer in the bar area twice for a limit of 7mins each and then he said we had to pay. You pay 5 euro for the entire time you are there for the internet which is reasonable.(if it works!) I was also overcharged one night and they cant just refund my card. I have to go through my bank now and dispute the charges so check your bill and make sure its right before you leave. Overall this hotel is fine. The best thing it has going for it is its location. We walked pretty much everywhere so it worked out well for us. We were on the 4th floor and our view was very nice. Also they do have free breakfast which was pretty descent.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: alfielanger
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel which is on a busy road so there is plenty of traffic noise if you open the windows! Situated near to a number of goverment buildings and a short walk to the shops and cafes / bars. Location is good for Trevi Fountain, approx 5 mins and other major sites not too far to walk. Breakfast is self service and adequate for the price. Lift is something out of the stoneage but it works. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: r8mooney
Reviews.Content: Myself and Girlfriend arrived on the 28th Jan 11. Greeted by very friendly and helpful receptionist. Showed to our room on the 4th floor. Had read reports about the lift being old and slow, and can confirm it is very old and 25 seconds from ground to forth. This wasn't a problem as hotel didn't seem too busy and not once did we have to wait for other users. The room was very pleasing, clean and spacious with a roman style decor. The bed was 2 singles pushed together, not the most comfortable but OK. The breakfast was sufficient also, no complaints with taste. Location was perfect and the big plus point, near the middle of all main sites and easily walkable. Termini station 15-20mins Spanish Steps 10mins Trevi Fountain 5mins Vatican 25-30mins Colosseum 5-10mins Came away feeling really pleased, hotel wasn't the cheapest about but I feel I got good value for money. I would like to warn you about my only bad experience in Rome. I took a guided tour of the Vatican with, When In Rome Tours. 45 euro for a terrible experience (15euro without guide). The tour boosts about not queuing but not only did we have to wait 40 minutes (Apparently introduction but all repeated again inside) waiting for them to rustle up some more people but we had to queue like anyone else. The tour guide Luigi fobbed us off with excuses. This tour was supposed to show us St Peter's Basilica and tombs, but when we got through the museum Luigi showed us where to go and left, obviously on his way for next Tour. When in the Sistine Chapel we got 10 minutes max to enjoy the paintings before being rushed out, not near long enough. This continued throughout our 1hour 40 minutes with the tour, Luigi even had the cheek to say we got extra time as had to queue, a great guy. . NOT. A cheap money making scam which will ruin your trip to Vatcian.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JingLi
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for two days in Dec 2010. Tried to book it for longer but it was all full. Great location, walking distance to Trevi fountain and the Pantheon. Breakfast was quite nice for this price range. Most of the staff were friendly but the daytime receptionist is sometimes aloof. Our only complain was that we weren't able to book it for longer!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IgalFeuerstein
Reviews.Content: The Hiberia hotel is not the best hotel we stayed at for 160EU per night. I would rate it as an average over priced 3 star hotel. The location is superb. Right in the center of everything. You can walk to almost all the main attractions. The room was OK, the double bed was average. We got two extra junior beds for our kids and they were not comfy at all! The view from our room (419) was awesome (I attached a photo). The room was quite, the bath was OK, warm towels, always hot water. The breakfast was delicious, nice and comfortable eating room. The stuff was helpful, most of them spoke good English. I ordered WIFI for 5EU for all 5 days, and was disappointed that it did not work at all. If you need to use your laptop, you better make sure that the WIFI works in your room before you complete the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dannita2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room at Hotel Hiberia (2x2 married couples - family). The room was a good size and had a lovely view out of the 4th floor window. The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. The location is excellent, within walking distance of all the main attractions and close enough to walk to from the Termini if you don't mind pulling your suitcase around. There are good eating places not too far away too. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: dinkam81
Reviews.Content: I have been to this Hotel in November after reading all the good rewievs post-it in the site. I confirm that the location is one of the best: the rooms are totally new; breakfast was one of the best in Italy and the staff was amazing especially Raffaele at the desk. I' ll back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel wouldn't stay anywhere else - Location, Food, Rooms !!!”
Reviews.Author: SAinCR
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nites at the Hotel Hiberia in Rome. We arrived and spent 3 nites. The hotel stored our luggage for a week free of charge as we went to other parts of Italy then we returned back to Hotel Hiberia for our final nite in Italy. This hotel exceeded EVERY expectation we had. It's location is ideal. Right near Street Nazionale one of the main roads in Rome, so easy to hop on a bus to go here and there or walk anywhere. ALL major attractions are within walking distance of this hotel - Trevi Fountain, Colliseum, Forum, SPanish Steps, you name it they are near it. Just a short bus ride to Termini Station (we traveled through Italy by train and it was super easy getting to the station - only 3 bus stops). The included breakfast was the BEST we had in Italy and their croissants (filled with cream and chocolate and even plain) were the best we've ever had anywhere. The breakfast buffet had fresh delicious pastries, eggs, sausage, bacon, various breads, yogurt, cereals, cheese, meats, unlimited cappucino and espresso and teas.. just fantastic and also the longest breakfast time on our trip. The hotel staff was FANTASTIC.. every person on duty was friendly, helpful and accommodating. They were happy to recommend restaurants, local attractions or assist with anything else you need. If you bring your laptop you can use their wifi otherwise they have a computer in the lobby which was never crowded and always available and very inexpensive 30 min for 2 euros. The rooms were updated, nicely painted with bright yet soothing colors, the beds were super comfortable, the bathrooms all had bidets and hi end showers with multi jets. We loved this hotel. It exceeded all our expectations and was the best accommodation we have experienced on our 3 week trip through Italy, Turkey and Greece. This hotel was near everything yet was quiet, quaint and just lovely. It had a nice restaurant attached to it but we did not eat at this restaurant as we were busy in other places. DON'T HESITATE.. BOOK HOTEL HIBERIA.. you won't be sorry and will come back time and again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and staff”
Reviews.Author: eoesau
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was a great value for the money. It was located close to everything. Our room was small but clean. the elevator was ancient but I thought it gave the place some character. The front desk staff was amazing especially Dino. If I am lucky enough to go back to Rome I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Put on your walking shoes and head off to see the sights of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: alandcas
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was very good - lots to see within walking distance. The hotel itself was having some work done whilst we were there, hence scaffolding at our window, but no doubt will be all the better for this. I had a cold shower one day out of the 4, but that was not too much of an issue. It did take a while for the water to heat every morning though. Breakfast was in the small restaurant next door, which you can enter from the hotel and it was quite substantial - buffet style of hot bacon and scrambled eggs and also juices, cereals, yoghurts, rolls, croissents etc. Very filling and enjoyable! The reception staff were very friendly, and we promptly received extra pillows when we asked for them. We fell into bed every night exhausted and had an excellent nights sleep, The bed was firm, but that is how we like it. We paid 5euro for 12 hour internet as we had our own laptop, and this was good but not the best connection for skype, but we could at least send and receive emails. There is a computer available for guests to use. All in all a good, clean and comfortable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: linchch
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Hiberia Hotel, Rome in April 2010 (just after Iceland Volcano eruption). We received a very friendly welcome, had a clean room, and received a fantastic buffet breakfast. I think you definately get what you pay for, and I highly recommend this hotel. It is close to all the tourist attractions and not in a dodgy area. The only downfall was that the airconditioning unit leaked water into my handbag which I had placed underneath it, my fault...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Skyliteee
Reviews.Content: 100 percent for this hotel. The location is really in the middle of Rome. It was perfect to reach the most important places easily by foot. The hotel was clean and the rooms were comfortable. The price was fair. The hotel staff were all very nice and all the time helpfull. We really would stay there again the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel discovery in central rome. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: cruzan1
Reviews.Content: Central location - most attractions nearby. FANTASTIC staff, respond to all requests. Requests for hypoallergenic pillows fulfilled, a request many hotels would not accomodate. Room airconditioned as promised. Nice breakfast in next door restuarant included in price. Room nice and clean. No clock in room. A real hidden gem in central Rome. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Roma”
Reviews.Author: MisterBespoke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hiberia for 5 nights during a July heatwave and the wonderful air-conditioned room and lovely shower in the bathroom saved us from heat prostration. The hotel is in the perfect location to walk and see most every site of note in Rome. You are 5 minute walk to the Forum or the Trevi just name a couple sites. The Vatican is a short taxi ride away. We could have easily walked there if it wasn't so darned hot. The staff led by Raffaelle(?) and Dino could not have been nicer and more helpful. These guys were fantastic! The breakfast buffet was also great with freshly cooked eggs, bacon and sausage. The rooms were very elegant. Spectacular value for your money at the Hiberia.

Reviews.Title: “NIce location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: KingOfTheValley
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome and stayed at Hiberia for 4 days. We landed at FCO and took a limo that we prearranged by email (info@romeshuttlelimousine.com). The driver was waiting at the arrival gate with a card bearing our name and drove us to Hiberia. Please note that you cannot drive a rental car to the HIBERIA!!!! It is inside the walled city and only certain types of vehicles can "legally enter" that area (apparently, I am told!) - certainly not rental cars! The hiberia had nice breakfast, and the staff are outstanding especially Paolo. The only scary thing there is the elevator which must date back to the roman era (ahem-ahem). Also the elevator area smells kinda funky! Other than that the breakfast was good and the rooms are well appointed for the price you pay. I would definitely recommend that you use the tours to see the place if you are on limited time in Rome. The front desk can set you up and there is a discount for 4 or more guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay at Hotel Hiberia”
Reviews.Author: kjw2010
Reviews.Content: We had read good reviews prior to going to Hotel Hiberia and they were all true. We had a great stay there. Excellent location, nice rooms and decor, good service and helpful staff, and good breakfast. The train station and major sights are within walking distance or an easy bus ride. The deluxe room is significantly bigger than standard room, and the spa bath is very nice! (We had 2 nights in deluxe room and one night in standard room due to staying there on 2 occasions). We walked from the train station with our bags (20-30mins) and caught the bus back when we left, Mainly walked to the major sights, caught bus a couple of times. Were given a light breakfast when we had to leave early one morning. We highly recommend this hotel for an easy and pleasant stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, pretty base for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: holidayrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with our 3 young children. Our room (deluxe, quad) was great. Extremely comfortable beds [with new latex matresses]; beautiful bathroom; lovely terrace. Quiet, clean. Front desk was helpful but not intrusive. Gave honest advice and arranged taxis for us. Included breakfast was nice, convenient and had good variety and quantity. Location was convenient, but a bit removed to make it quiet at night. Easy walk to all sights except Vatican, which we took train to get to. Nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant base for our trip!”
Reviews.Author: madcadd
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a deal through an airline and therefore were not 100% sure of what kind of place we would be staying - we reasoned that since we wouldn't really be spending much time in our room, hotel quality wasn't necessarily a priority. We should say that we never booked for breakfast at the hotel and so cannot comment on its quality. All that mattered to us was that the hotel was central and it most certainly was. We travelled to the hotel using the train from the airport to the Termini station and taxi from there. We later discovered that if we had contacted the hotel in advance we could have booked a chauffeur driven car to take us directly from the airport to the hotel for less than the public transport route had cost. We actually used this service for our return journey to the airport and highly recommend it. The hotel itself is a little rough around the edges but very clean and the staff on the desk were absolutely brilliant. Our room had everything we needed - and most importantly for two girls who don't travel light, ample storage space for all our belongings. The room had air-con and we had no issues at all with the unit or noise from the street (Via XXIV Maggio). The location is fantastic and within the first day and a half had seen/stumbled across several of the main landmarks and piazzas without having strayed very far at all. The vatican is about a mile away but it is easy to navigate your way by foot which gives you more opportunities to find the many hidden gems in Romes backstreets. We never had to use public transport after our arrival. Walking was fantastic and helped you to get your bearings but sensible shoes are a must as the terrain varies greatly. The friendliness and helpfullness of the Hotel Hiberia staff were a high point of our holiday. They did all the stressful jobs for us from booking tours and transport to making reservations and reccomending authentic restaurants and entertainments and their familiarity with all the guests made it a much more personal experience rather than feeling like just another tourist. We had a great time in Rome and would definately like to revisit both the hotel and the beautiful city sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...but so are others!”
Reviews.Author: ZAIDYY
Reviews.Content: Reaching the hotel from the train station is simple enough; go out the main entrance; cross the bus stop and walk ahead until you reach "Viale V. Einaudi" where you will find an obelisk on your left hand side; walk down the street and it will bring you to the large "Piazza Della Repubblica"; take left and walk until the end of the street"Via Nazionale". it took us 15minutes with one suitcase and one backpack. The hotel is indeed "reasonably" close to Rome's main attractions (except the Vatican, but you can take the bus or the metro); however, I wouldn't take the hotel's website's word for it! site-seeing is indeed possible on foot, but it's not 5 minutes walk from everything! Rooms are small but we barely stayed in; large bed and clean bathroom; breakfast selection is limited but what's available is good. COUNT MINI-BAR ITEMS ONCE YOU'RE IN THE ROOM. they should match the list in the room guide; if not, do inform reception and do not wait until you check out. We stayed in room 315 which you may want to avoid if you're easily bothered by traffic as it faces a very busy street "Via XXIV Maggio". AC unit works but "Strangely" decided it's cold enough to go into "standby" in the middle of the night! luckily, the weather was still not hot enough to wake us up. There are quite several other hotels in "Via Nazionale" which you may want to research before deciding where to stay; we booked this one based on reviews and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Less than great stay, but a great location”
Reviews.Author: Stefeire
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute when we decided to go back to Rome, and the price and location were what we were looking for. When we were taken to our 1st room it smelled strongly of smoke and we asked to be moved. After a bit of attitude from reception we were then moved to the 1st floor and to a room that was noticeably older, perhaps the other had been recently been remodeled or something? In any case, the room we were in was fairly spacious, and not super noisy considering it faced the main street. However there was mold all along the ceiling in the bathroom, which wasn't in the best shape in general. The main issue we had with the hotel was the smell in the hallway leading to our room. It smelled like a dirty diaper, despite the fact that we saw the maids vacuuming every morning. Fortunately the smell didn't invade our room, but it was quite odorous when you had to go out. The breakfast was actually the best part of the hotel, lots of food, including scrambled eggs and bacon along with the pastries, yogurt, fruit, and cereal. The location was convenient to sightseeing, we walked everywhere from there. Though I suggest getting a cab from Termini, its worth the 11 euros to not haul bags that far. It served our needs, but I would not choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and comfortable hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidaysGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Possibly the most expensive hotel we have stayed in but far from the best. Booked at the last minute so found a limited range of decent hotels available -none at reasonable prices probably because it was Easter. Very nice, characterful accommodation, and a comfortable, spacious room for my family . The great location and time of year presumably accounted for much of the cost. One key member of reception staff was borderline unfriendly and consistently unhelpful with even the most basic of enquiries about directions to sights only a few streets away which let the hotel down enormously -all other staff very friendly and very accommodating. The hotel would do well to address this since it seems to be a recurring theme in these reviews on Trip Advisor. Breakfast was good if you were early enough to get a selection of hot or cold foods. Despite not appearing over crowded cutlery, crockery and rolls were often finished well before the end of the breakfast serving period. Hot eggs and bacon made for a welcome addition to the continental breakfast reppertoire. Overall not value for money at at 280 euros a night for the room and breakfast. Would only recommend this hotel if rates were more reflective of the service and standard of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: azmi1
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location Excellent staff--all spoke English, were friendly and very helpful. Never led us astray Clean room Beds comfortable Daily service with towels and cleaning Cons: Room was small Elevator was unreliable (we called it the adventure ride!) We had to go up to the fifth floor to get to the fourth, but we just got a kick out of the character of the place Breakfast was adequate but nothing really tasty Would definitely stay there again. It had everything that I needed and was so easy to walk to everything of interest. We never had to take a bus, train or taxi anywhere until we left for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumeet34
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was a little higher priced, it was well worth it. It was within a 10 minute walk of all major sights except for Vatican City. The room was clean and good sized, front desk was helpful, breakfast was more extensive compared to others in Italy we stayed at, and a computer in the lobby provided a fast connection to the Internet for 5 euro fee. the one negative was that it was warm and the AC wasn't working. Overall, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service....only one stenchy issue”
Reviews.Author: Penticles
Reviews.Content: GOOD POINTS The location cannot be understated. It is within clost proximity to all locations except the Vatican (although we still walked there and back). The staff are very welcoming and friendly and they strive to please. Bearing in kind the hotel rating they were not able to provide us with a kettle in the room that we needed primarily for our baby daughter's milk etc. However they did tell supply us with free hot water in stainless steel jugs any time we asked for it. Breakfast is pretty decent too. The room furnishings are not my taste but they were spacious enough to cater for a family + baby (incl. a cot) and had room where to park an open stroller. Our room was not facing the main road and hence pretty quiet. My only complaint was the bathroom - It was big enough, albeit aged but stank. Since the hotel was at full occupancy they were unable to change our room. The maids did try and solve the problem but this was never fully solved. Fortunately the stench was mostly contained to the bathroom. A good tip - the restaurant next to the hotel is worth a visit and we dined there 3 times during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Compact”
Reviews.Author: jafergusonuk
Reviews.Content: On arrival the staff were friendly and helpful. However getting a drink at the bar proved less successful as the "porter" did not seem to understand that we wanted 2 glasses of red wine. No he did not have any and anyway the fridge was not working??? Our room was in usual italian style, sparse, tiled floor but a pleasingly large bed. The bathroom was another story. Why is it that hotels never cater for the basics like somewhere to put toothbrush and shaving kit and makeup for the other half. There was a good shower, but the horror was the stink of bad plumbing / sewers. This spoilt what could have been a reasonable stay. The bed was as comfortable and large as any I have slept in, and compensated to a small degree on the smell which we mitigated by leaving the window open. The air con never worked anyway! The room had a flat screen tele, but as is so often the case in Italy there were no English channels. Not even CNN or other American news channel let alone the BBC. Do they think only Italians visit Rome? The best feature of the hotel was its location. It really was central to all the sites and everything was walkable. We did all the main attractions, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colloseum, Forum, Pantheon and Vatican City; all by foot and non further than 30 minutes (Vatican). Another feature was the ease to get to the hotel from the Airport. We took the Airport bus to the Tremini and walked down Via Nationale to our hotel (15 minutes). We were unlucky enough to be in a room next to a baby which cried several times in the night each night and I would willingly have strangled the parents who seemed to be ...... prats. This and the smell lowered my enjoyment of the hotel, but if we had been more sensible and asked for another room I am sure they would have accomodated us. But we, being typically British and stoic, did not complain. I feel bad about that, because I should have and I am sure if I was American, I would have in which case everything would have been better. Would I stay there again? Yes if I had a room where the plumbing did not insult my nose and the people in the adjoining room were quiet (like us). Overall a great trip in spite of these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised here on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: envesting1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and relied on the great reviews in making our arrangements. We wanted a place where the hotel did what it needed to do in order for us to enjoy our visit to Rome and Hiberia was just right. On the service front, it was 5 star all the way -- Giuseppe and his associates were remarkably helpful (the comments about Giuseppe on this site are, if anything, understated, he's just that good), with helpful recommendations on nearly everything. Maid service was great. The breakfast was delightful. The superior location cannot be overstated. The room and price were were right in line with our expectations. We walked everywhere and/or took the nearby bus, with Giuseppe patiently showing us on a map exactly where to go to find this church or that cafe or making tour arrangements or dinner recommendations and so on. We would unhesitatingly stay here again and recommend this hotel and Giuseppe to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.....”
Reviews.Author: egim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to all points of interest except the Vatican. It is also close to the shopping places, which was a positive for my teenage daughter. The timing of our visit conincided with the Caravaggio exhibit in the museum that is just a few steps from the hotel. There is also an excellent restaurant behind the hotel - Santa Cristina, which my husband and I were introduced to in 2008, Hotel staff from the desk to chambermaids are all friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DorchesterBev
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and have to say the location is just perfect. You are 10/15 minutes from the major attractions. The rooms are not big but are just fine for a quick stay. The location is good as not on a major road and helps to keep the noise levels down. Breakfast was included in the rate (we booked with Booking.com) and it was a fine start to the day. Rome is very expensive but was really worth it - I have never been to such and ohhh ahhhh place with so much to see. We bought a Roma pass but thought it wasnt really worth it. Got the Terravision coach from the airport which was quick and easy. The Termini is not a good introduction to Rome so dont take too much notice when the bus drops you off. I would stay at the Hiberia again because of the superb location and the staff being so helpful. Watchout for the lovely tiles in the rooms - Versace!

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend enough, location location location”
Reviews.Author: winterTraveller09
Reviews.Content: This was excellent place to stay inRome. Ahh Rome, an abosulte gem of a place, and so was this hotel. It is located 10 min walk to trevi fountain, and 5 min in other direction is the start of all the historical highlights of Rome. We loved our stay here, just book it, you won't regret it! Remeber though, in Europe, their hotel standards are not very high for 3-4 star hotels, compared to Australia. So don't expect the hilton for your room, but seriously, you spend hardly any time in it because Rome is awetsome and you won't want to waste time in your hotel. So for the price and the location, you won't do better!Staff aren't that helpful, only 1 in 3 recpetion staff is pleasant. Our room was too hot in winter, they kept telling us they would do something about it, but never did. Just book it, don't waste any more time reading reviews! Oh and DON'T catch a cab, they will try and charged you 25 euros from the train station and it's only 1 euro bus ride about 4 blocks down from train station!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for making our stay unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: BettyBAthens
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its proximity and reasonable price. It was everything we expected and more! We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends for its friendly, hospitable atmosphere, smiling and helpful staff and cleanliness.Don't miss out on the best gastronomic experience at the restaurant next door!!! We would like to thank you for making our trip pleasant and trouble-free!

Reviews.Title: “Hiberia hotel is great, look for Giuseppe!”
Reviews.Author: noregretgirl
Reviews.Content: within walking distance to EVERYTHING, a short trip on bus 40 from the train station, and a good breakfast buffet! I traveled to Rome for the first time, and Giuseppe, the desk clerk was so nice, spoke perfect english, and was a fantastic tour guide on my last night there. Don't pass up this little gem, but if you travel alone, book a double room!! I

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass up this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gartrip
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome with my daughter and friends. There were many hotels to choose from but we got the name of this hotel from a friend who had stayed here two years ago. It was the best decision we made. From entering the lobby, we were greeted as special guests by Guiseppe and Demitri. The rooms were not ready but they made accomodations for us. They helped us plan our day and made us cappucinos to revive our wilting bodies. Once upon getting our rooms, I decided to see if we could upgrade ours to a bigger room. They showed me an available one that was absolutely perfect and I took it. The original room had a great view but three single beds and I wanted more space which is what I got. The bathroom was quite large and had every amenity we could want, including heated towels. The floors were a lovely tile and the most important thing is the room was exceptionally clean. The maid service came in every morning and refreshed what we needed. The windows in the room sound proofed the outside and we never heard street noise. The interior walls are so thick that you don't hear people next door or in the corridors. Dino, who was at the front desk every night, helped us out immensely by offering restaurants and itineraries. He was warm and welcoming as was everyone else we came in contact with. And he arranged for us to have a car take us back to the airport which saved us time, money and worries. Breakfast was beyond what you would expect and well worth it. The eggs, coffee, yogurt, toast, etc. was delicious. I travel for a living and am very particular about my hotel and I would sum up this lengthy review by saying ..."Service, Service, Service" is what you get from this gem of a hotel. Don't pass it up.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarioDucati
Reviews.Content: Hiberia Hotel is a very nice and clean hotel. It's pretty close to most historic places in Rome. What I liked about this hotel was its very kind and helpful staff from the management to the housekeeping. I enjoyed every moment of it prior to check in (reservation) to the check out. I don't think I would ever stay at any other hotels as long as I'm in Rome. Contact the manager Paolo or the assistant manager Dino. They are the most helpful and friendly hotel managers that I've ever met.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ryanandamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights in August, and found it to be a great place from which to see some of the main sights in old rome. The food was good, the rooms were nice, but its main draw was the location, as we could walk pretty much anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, nice sized room; very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: j_loder1
Reviews.Content: The Hiberia is about a five minute walk from the Trevi Fountain. It's also an easy walk to the Coloseum. The room was of good size and it was clean. The bathroom was decent and clean. The concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, LOCATION. Hiberia great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bodybuilderdude
Reviews.Content: The Hiberia hotel is one of the few hotels in probably the most ideal location one could ever stay in the Eternal City. They are down the block from their "White House". The location is within a 10 min walk to Trevi Fountain, the Spanish steps, Pantheon a bit further. The opposite direction, like a 10 min stroll to the Collesium. A walk to Vatican City is 30-35 min if you don't stroll. If hoofing it isn't your cup of American coffee, then the bus stop is just a 3 min walk from the front door of this hotel, where bus 64 will take you along the main drag to Campo Fiori or Vatican City, or the opposite direction to Termini Station. As for the Hotel itself, please people, remember this is Rome, where some buildings have been standing for centuries, not the Hyatt Resort in Maui. The hotel somewhat sits away from the corner of the street. As you face the hotel, there is a small alley on the left and part of a church complex build directly next to it. The doors automatically open when you enter (nice with having luggage) and directly to your right is the reception desk. The reception/bar area is all new looking, and pleasant. The staff working the front desk, I will have to say were 100 percent very warm, personalble and hospitable. Check-in was a snap. We were given room 101 on the lowest floor which was fine for us. The stairs/lift were directly across from our room door. We reserved a double standard room. The room was renovated, and the double bed consisted of two beds pushed together, we didn't even notice that was the case. The bed was extremely comfortable. It had a closet, along with end tables, vanity and tv set, whether it worked or not, was insequiencal, as neither one of us turned it on the entire 4 day stay while there. The room had a window, with shutters, which I immediately opened, and it looked out into the building next door, and the alley. This did not disappoint me in one bit, as I don't stay at a hotel to sit and watch the view. The room had a very well functioning airconiditoner which we used off and on along with opening the window at night to let the cool Rome night air in. (I hate hotels where you can't open the window). The bath room, is like in a small closet! LOL. I am 5-11, and a body builder, at 220lbs. The hot water worked, yes the shower stall was small, but I managed THIS IS ROME! I personally don't use bidets so they could of removed that, and would give the bath more room, but apparently, Europeans like their bidets. Ha. Ha. One thing that my partner had difficulty using was the in-room safe, which was faulty. The manger came in less than 5 min, and fixed it. As for the helpfulness of Hiberia Hotel staff....they couldn't of been nicer. We asked for directions to this, that or whatever, and they were very accomodating. The breakfast room was directly underneath, and entrance down and around the corner from our room. There is enough kind of breakfast foods that would please a wide variety of eaters. The scrambled eggs were tasty, the many pastiries, cereals, yogurts, friuit, etc. I always travel with my high protien oatmeal, and made use of the hot water. My only suggestion to the staff is that bacon/sausage should be cooked a bit longer than what they presented each day, but, even though I may prefer more crisp, solid bacon, Europeans have a different bent on cooking so, I lived with it. If I wanted bacon or sausage cooked the way I like it cooked, I'd be home in LA. So, I have no complaints. The coffee machine they have I would love to have here at home, the cappicinnos were the morning wake up of caffiene for me. Since were are airline employees, we use the internet a bit to check our schedules, and flight availability for standby travel. Next to the bar is an internet area, where they provided us access to the net. Hotel space in Rome was very, very tight, this particular weekend with the Holy Father Cannonizing 5 on Sunday (which was the purpose of our trip). The Hiberia was listed at like some 280.00 a night. I had frequent flyer miles and used them to pay for our hotel stay. If I had to pay that kind of rate, would I stay here? Probably not. I'm cheap, and probably wouldn't of even made the trip. But, the fact is, I did make the trip, and if it hadn't been for a busy weekend like this in Rome, the rates would of been more swallowable. If I could find a decent rate at this hotel, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel look no further!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pillarDevon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick break in Rome, went to port for 2 nights, then into Rome for one night staying at Hotel Hiberia, did loads of research before going to check out reviews and this got great reviews which I can now back up, location fabulous, 10 minute stroll to Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps, Coliseum not much further, staff very helpful, room lovely absolutely spotless, breakfast was good selection with hot and cold selection, would defo recommend to anyone!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “An alright place to sleep... if you're afraid of stairs don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: LisaandNelson
Reviews.Content: At a glance the hotel seems ok. It was clean but pretty run down looking. The elevator was completely unpredictable... we never took it once. We had the bellboy take it up with our luggage while we took the stairs. The room was a good size but I didn't care for the lay out. It was a bit awkward and difficult to reach the windows which had shutters on the outside. It's on a main road so it was pretty noisy at night... nothing a bottle of wine can't fix. The staff spoke enough English and were polite and helpful. The breakfast was disappointing... scrambled eggs and hot dogs. They also had the usual Italian fare: cold cuts, buns, jams, sweet breads, juice etc. They had a computer but you had to pay to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, location, value, location, value...”
Reviews.Author: TheCanadianVoice
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hiberia is a must-stay for anyone who likes to save money and be in the middle of it all! My wife and I travelled around Europe for three weeks and this was our favourite location and hotel along the way (besides her Aunt Jean's house of course :-D) The rooms are small in comparison to north American standards but ample for your stay. Comfortable bed, nice size bathroom (when notified of plugged shower drain front desk had someone there immediately to clear it) and a window that opened for some fresh air along with working air conditioning. An in-room safe is a nice feature and ample storage for your bags and to hang your clothes. This hotel is in the middle of everywhere! We didn't take any public transit or taxis while in Rome because we didn't have to. Hotel Hiberia has you in the centre of it all. Trevi Fountain 7-10 minutes walk, Circus Maximus 15 minutes, Pantheon 20 minutes, Coloseum 30 minutes and Piazza Venicia 5 minutes while Vatican City is about half an hour too. Do yourself a favour and be sure to visit the continental breakfast. Grab an extra hard boiled egg and some cheese with crackers and throw them in your backpack for snacks throughout the day! The only negative point was that during our stay the wireless internet was down but we found an internet cafe with the help of the front desk staff and it was cheap anyways. The front desk staff was wonderful and a great help when planning our days and finding our ways. My wife and I will be back at the Hotel Hiberia it's just a matter of time ;-D

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a great hotel in Rome? Look no further”
Reviews.Author: twopointfourchildren
Reviews.Content: My Mum ,Sister and I stayed at The Hiberia Hotel for 3 nights and had a very comfortable stay. We each had a single room and yes they were small but they were very clean ,well equipt and well presented the staff were very helpful and friendly and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise - enjoyed it very much!”
Reviews.Author: saritamar
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rome. This was our first time in Rome and weren't sure about the location however it turned out to be great: a few steps from Via Nazionale, a short walk from Trevi fountain and everything else. The room was clean, comfortable and welcoming. The air conditioning was crucial and it worked well. The shower and WC were new and clean. We were very surprised about breakfast - we expected "Continental" and enjoyed the choices and fresh coffee. The staff was great, answered any question. We truly enjoyed our stay, and we thank the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location;good value”
Reviews.Author: oxfordhighschool
Reviews.Content: It's not perfect but we paid 80 euros nightly for 2 single rooms (bookings.com) & feel very satisfied. Aircon was iffy in one room but a fan was supplied on request, breakfast is excellent-cappuccino freshly made, scrambled eggs, cheese, sausages, croissants in the buffet. Small showers & bidets in the new, spotless bathrooms, comfy beds, VERY quiet-a new lift (elevator) to our rooms (118 & 117). No view but I gather great views from the 4th fl.rooms. Wireless internet in the rooms costs 13 euros daily. Location is the prime reason to stay here; it's right where you want to be to sample Rome's many delights. Right next door is a terrific & inexpensive rest, opposite a good snack bar for 'spremuta di arancia' (fresh orange juice). Friendly, helpful staff. Room safe in wardrobe.We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: selilekwi
Reviews.Content: I changed my accommodation booking in Rome at the last minute before leaving Australia and am very happy I did. This hotel is in a good location and easy walking distance from Palazzo Quirinale (2 min), Trevi Fountain (10 min) , Le Quattro Fontane (10 mins) Piazza Barberini (15 min) Spanish Steps (20 min), Piazza Venezia (5 min), Il Vittoriano (5 min), Trajan's Column (5 min) and the Coliseum (10 min). I got a cab from Roma Termini Station which took about 10 mins and cost about 15 euro which I agreed to before I got into the cab. Be aware though that taxi drivers will try to take you for a ride and not in a good way (the cabbie tried to tell me initially it would cost 28 euro which was simply outrageous given the short distance from the station to the hotel). The hotel was much nicer than I expected for a 3 star and well worth the money I paid. The room was a good size for one person especially given the room next to mine was a fraction of the size and only had a single bed in it. It was clean and neat and while the heating was a little too warm at certain times of the day I was able to cool things down by opening the windows when necessary. It was perfect for me. The room amenities included a safe and fat screen TV with CNN for the English speakers and a minibar. There is also an internet point in the hotel bar which costs 1 euro for 12 minutes. The hotel lift is apparently original and 100 years old. I thought it was a charming touch although I overheard other guests bemoaning its size and efficiency. On the whole Reception staff were helpful with questions and recommendations although at times they seemed overwhelmed and a bit stressed. Breakfast was included in the tariff and is provided in the restaurant adjacent to the hotel. The buffet included juices (dispenser only) coffee (both dispenser and barista) and chilled water. A hot choice was provided of scrambled eggs, sausage links, bacon and toast. Cereals, canned fruit, yoghurt, fresh bread rolls, pastries, scones, muffins, rice cakes and a variety of packet crackers and cookies were also available. Sliced cheese and cold cuts were also available as well as cream cheese portions and preserves. The restaurant is also open for lunch and dinner most days (not for Saturday lunch and no service on public holidays) and while I ate there because as a lone traveler it was convenient (and safer than venturing out alone to look for something else) I was really disappointed with the food which was way below par. I’m not sure though whether this reflects on the hotel in any way as they not have much say about the menu or the kitchen staff. If you choose to eat here in the evenings I do suggest you are prepared for a long wait as there seems to be only 2 wait staff who are utterly run off their feet which might explain their demeanor. I waited 30 minutes for my bill one evening once I had managed to gain their attention which also took quite a bit of doing. There is an excellent snack bar opposite the Hotel for take away lunches and snacks and a bar around the corner that has live music most nights. Overall for a three star hotel this place was a real find, and a comfortable place to stay that was close to most things. I recommend it for single travelers and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bad Service.”
Reviews.Author: goobysnack
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much from the hotel, as it is inexpensive (for Rome) and in a great location. However, the room was HOT, and the front desk was unresponsive. I don't expect much from any hotel, but I do expect to sleep well. As a result of the heat, in MARCH, I didn't have a good nights rest for 4 days until I left. We complained on the 2nd day, but the front desk neither fixed the problem nor did they ask us if the problem had been resolved. 25 degrees C at 2am without the heat turned on makes for a restless night. I think this is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ciaobellaScotland
Reviews.Content: The Hiberia Hotel had a number of good reviews which is why I felt confident about booking a short stay there. The location of the hotel is an ideal base for seeing the sites of Rome, we walked to all the sites from here. The hotel itself is very clean and we found the staff very pleasant and helpful. The room we had, at the rear of the building, was a reasonable size and was very quiet during the night. Perhaps the rooms facing the front of the building would not be so quiet as the hotel sits on a fairly busy street. The room was cleaned to a good standard every day. The breakfast was also good, with plenty to choose from, only one disappointment was that the fruit appeared to be tinned fruit, rather than fresh. There was a selection of other hot and cold foods to cater for all tastes. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: maclover_it
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just 1 night. Seeing tripadvisor rating it just a 2 star I was a bit scared, but upon arriving everything turned out to be perfect.
