Location is very convenient, just 100 meters from Quirinale and 5 minutes walking to Trevi. I had a single bedded room with breakfast included for a very reasonable price: 64€ VAT included: terrific for central Rome. In my opinion the hotel deserves a 3 stars rating here. Room was very clean and comfortable. Of course it was on the small side but for just one guest it is perfect. Breakfast was very nice. It was well above my expectations. I think if price will be in the 60-80€ range again I'll go back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short break”
Reviews.Author: marco0621
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect. The location is very central, friendly staff who speak several foreign languages and not too big in the number of rooms. We were granted a big room in the front of the hotel. I guess this is not a standard room. My experience with Italian hotels is usually small rooms. So, or we were lucky or it was just off season. Anyway, we were pleased with the space in the room and jacuzzi in the bathroom. Elevator is located along the staircase and is small but fits the old building. Breakfast was ok, not very special. But on the other side of the hotel there is a perfect snack bar with delicious sandwiches and coffees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in central Rome and outstanding value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ECAU
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break to the beautiful city of Rome & stayed at Hiberia Hotel. This hotel is so central to all of the main sights in Rome. We were approx 10mins walk to the breathtaking Trevi Fountain in one direction and heading the other direction we were just over 10mins walk to the Colessuem. We stayed on the 4th floor in room 420 and we were pleasantly suprised by the quality and size of the room. I had read so many reviews saying that the hotels in Rome were tiny and not so nice but this room while basically furnhised was very comfortable. The bathroom was nice and big, the only negative was that there was no shower curtain but the power of the shower was great! The room had a tv & mini bar which came in very handy. Breakfast was served from 7-10am and there was plenty on offer, cereals, fruit, yoghurts, crossaints, other pastries, boiled eggs etc. so we were more than happy with this. If you require a room with a stunning viewing you could ask for room 418. We managed to sneak and peak whilst it was being cleaned and the views were fantastic for an extra €30 per night. As I mentioned above this hotel is a really excellent hotel in terms of location. there are a couple of irish bars not so far from the hotel either. We literally walked everywhere but there is also bus stops at the top of the street that take you to the vatican city and termini station. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and if returning to Rome would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value For Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaldiveDiver
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within walking distant to all places of interest. Hotel is clean, fresh and very welcoming staff. excellent english and all very hepful. Our room was a corner room with views of the city. A comfy bed and large Shower room. We loved the Old Wooden lift. The breakfast was very good with lots of choice. The evening meals were very nice too and a good price. I would certainly stay here again and for a 3 star hotel it is a good price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hello Lady”
Reviews.Author: RSgroupie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Rome, Italy. Our group consisted of myself, my two daughters, and a good friend. We had a reservations at the Hiberia Hotel, and we couldn't have been more pleased. Upon arriving, we found the staff to be courteous and informative. Although my daughter is very knowledgable concerning Rome, itself, having lived there and speaks Italian quite well, the staff was happy to try their English out for us. We especially enjoyed the gentleman who kept calling us "lady". The room was very clean and an adequate size for a regular twin bedroom. My daughters had a room with a double bed and a walk-in shower. The rooms were cool as we were able to maintain the A/C ourselves. Although my friend and I shared a room at the front of the hotel, we found it to be quiet regardless of the traffic. We did not try the jacuzzi tub as it didn't look like it would be too accommodating; however, the bidet was a "hoot". Breakfast was exactly what we needed to start the day. The eggs were especially delicious. The location is ideal as it is an easy walk to the many of the tourist sights in addition to the bus stop for the #40 bus which goes to the Vatican area. It is a 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, shopping, and a number of wonderful cafes. Upon departing, the staff was helpful in securing a limo to the airport. There are two quaint pubs within a 5 minute walk from the hotel which we frequented. One serves fantastic sangria, and the other is an Irish pub called The Cork's Inn. We recommend that you try them after a long day of sightseeing. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: bdwhite1
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, decent rooms, nice bathrooms. We were there in the summer heat and the air condition wasn't super powerful, but adequate. The breakfast spread is pretty good and the front desk was very helpful and courteous. The elevator "lift" is old and small...sometimes its quicker to just walk upstairs

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ufmurphys
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (kids 13&11). We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Hiberia in a standard quad room and found it to be a great value. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very friendly and the location is unbeatable! Our room was basic but very clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was average. Our only disappointment was in learning they did not have a rooftop terrace. The terrace is only accessible if you book that particular room. We were able to walk everywhere within a few minutes. The farthest walk to the Vatican was still not a bad walk. We enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Smoolander
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hiberia was the first hotel on our 5 week trip through Italy and Europe and we stayed 4 nights. I tried to choose this location based upon the location and it really did not let us down. It was absolutely perfect, and my wife and I were able to walk to just about everything. The hotel is a 15 minute walk at most to all famous sights (10 minutes to Trevi Fountain and 5 minutes to Monument to Emanuelle, literally down the street from President’s Palace) and approximately a 30 minute walk to St Peter’s Square and the Vatican or a 10 minute bus ride. The hotel is located in what felt to be a nicer and safer part than around the Terminal Station (although we never felt threatened anywhere). The only negative we would have against the hotel was the room size, which was small, as well as the bathroom and shower, however we were only in the room to sleep and get ready to go out so it was never really an issue. The breakfast menu had a reasonable selection of food but get down early so the bread and croissants are fresh. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful and speak English well. All in all, a good hotel in a brilliant location where we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: nina99z
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, clean, centrally located with good breakfast. Piazza Venezzia is 5-10 minutes walk (down-hill); bus station for both direction, to Termini and Pza Venezzia, are within couple of minutes walk from hotel. Standard double room is quite small, shower box too. The noise from the street is constant, but bearable since the hotel is close to Via Nazionale. When the window is closed, it was O.K. We didnt have any problems with air conditioning, it worked perfectly. The Elevator looked old but it worked fine. Hiberia is good choise for exploring Rome, if you get a good deal for price, it is not worthed more than 120 euro for small double room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJQ5
Reviews.Content: Location - This hotel is in an ideal location for exploring the tourist attractions in Rome. Termini railway station is about a 15-20 minute walk away, however bus number 64 passes the hotel. A taxi from the station to the Hiberia cost me 7 euros and was well worth it in order to get a bit more familiar with that part of the city. The Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Colosseum, Spanish steps are all within easy walking distance. The Vatican can be reached by catching a number 40 bus just around the corner from the hotel. I would not recommend the open top tour bus as I found it pretty boring, and the staff were quite rude and unhelpful. Room - the double room was a decent size. Not very large, but comfortable. The room was clean and the shower was good. Breakfast was good. Hot breakfast, cereal and fruit all available. The coffee is from a machine... (the small snack bar accross the road serves nice coffee). Staff - the staff I spoke to were very helpful and answereed all my queries. Area - the surrounding are felt safe. I'd probably avoid the main street when looking for somewhere to eat. There are many nice places to eat in the side streets ad more remote locations. I found the area around the Trevi Fountain good for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmtomeo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near to Qurinale and Trevi Fountain. 3* and definitely deserves them. Room was lovely - nice decor, spacious, TV, hairdryer, nice shower cubicle, toiletries, mini-bar, nice furniture, air con (bit tricky to work) Fairly quiet but can just hear traffic from busy road. Worth it to be so near to attractions. Nice staff, bar and nice breakfast. Cooked egg, sausage, bacon, toast, cereals, tea, coffee, juice, fruit, pastries. All you could want. We booked on internet and got 2 nts twin room 2 people for £170 good value. Rome tips- dont use taxis they rip you off and public buses and metro are great and cheap. We got on buses but found no way to pay so we ended up having 6 free rides. make sure you do the hop-on-hop-off open-top tourist bus. You can pick it up round the corner from the hotel. Costs 16 euro each for day but you see loads. Book entrance to Colosseum online to avoid queues at ticket office. See the Popes address on Weds and Sun. Avoid summer as I hear its too hot and too crowded. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: markw23
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome, magical 3 days. are hotel was only 5 minutes walk from the trevi fountain and spanish steps.We satyed in room 414 which was very spacious and clean.Our only issue with the hotel was after a shower the bathroom floor got very wet and dangerous and all we got were extra towels.However apart from this the hotel was perfect and Dino was very helpful,i would have no problem reccommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: jmo488
Reviews.Content: I went to Italy last summer with my boyfriend and his parents and it was the best experience I've ever had! We where brought their by a friendly taxi driver who told us not to stay at our original hotel because of the bad area. This hotel is walking distance to everywhere and we where provided with really easy to navigate maps. It is close to everything in the city and the staff is really helpful. The hotel is quiet and the rooms are spacious and immaculate. Would recommend this place to all.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and disappointing- could do better in Rome”
Reviews.Author: chrisGOxfordUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day pre-Christmas trip to Rome. I booked a Deluxe Quadruple at the Hiberia as we are family of 4 and finding a family room in central Rome isn't that easy. The Hiberia is OK, but that's about all I could say for it. The location is very central but I think you could do a lot better. The hotel occupies a narrow site - seating downstairs in 'lounge' was along a bench- so no proper central lobby. Our room was on the top floor. The lift is one of the old metal cage types - fine if it is working but it was out of order during part of our stay. Luckily I am pretty fit as the steps are very steep - not good for small kids.! The room was small - not uncommon for old central Rome., but a squeeze for a double and two singles. Nothing to warrant the 'deluxe' label - at first I thought they had made a mistake as it didn't really correspond to the description on the website. We had a 'jacuzzi' in the small bathroom which my kids liked but afterwards the bath was filled with small flakes of black film from the water pipes. Breakfast downstairs was pretty poor - no pots of coffee or tea but a self-service vending machine, the bread stale, the 'fresh' orange juice more like bitter squash. My Italian friend who I went with managed to coax a cup of fresh cappucino from the waitress. I didn't find the staff very friendly - they were OK, but it was clear that this was a tourist operation. When I came to pay the final bill I paid by visa card then noticed that they had ovecharged me by 60 euros. It was only when I queried the bill in detail that they acknowledged they had made a mistake and refunded me 60 euros in cash. It made me a bit suspicious I normally like older small hotels but I found this one oddly charmless. I wouldn't stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: voxra
Reviews.Content: A wonderful, reasonably priced, hotel with very helpful staff. Looking at the floor plan in the corridor, I had one of the smaller rooms - but it was big enough, with several large mirrors helping making it feel bigger. Everything worked (not always a given), and it's close to a main road with bus connections every 2mins or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, price and location”
Reviews.Author: BernieandJune
Reviews.Content: I walked into the Hotel Hiberia after a stay in a hotel across the street, Hotel Giardino, that was far from satisfactory. What a difference. The rooms were bright, modern, comfortable and appeared newly renovated, all for only 10 Euros a night more. The front desk staff was very friendly and showed me a room that was available immediately (7am). Everything about this hotel was positive and its central location makes it a highly recommended hotel, including 2 English TV channels. Be aware it is on a 2 lane street that does have traffic. We asked for an inside/back room, and we heard no traffic noice above the usual din of Rome. There is a major bus stop a few hundred feet from the hotel so all transportation is also avail. if planning a trip to the Vatican Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarahms
Reviews.Content: We had booked a deluxe room and were given room 414 which had lovely views over the rooftops - We could see St Peters! The lift is an old fashioned caged one which I found really charming - we had no problems with its operation. The room is the disabled room so had a "wet room" shower so the floor did get a bit wet but they gave us extra towels to put down -this really was no problem at all. Large and very comfortable bed and the room and bedding were spotless - there was an extra bed in the room as I think it is normally a family room - it was handy to put things on!! We only went to breakfast twice (we aren't breakfast people really) - it was a bit bland but I found the hot water for the tea piping hot and there was plenty of everything. The staff were exceptionally helpful and gave us some good advice. The location is brilliant - we walked everywhere including to the Vatican Restaurants within a 5 minute walk were plentiful and really nice - particularly the Santa Cristina directly behind the hotel on Via Cordonata. Only 2 very small things to point out! The hairdryer is one of those on the wall in the bathroom and not very useful when you have thick hair like me - so top tip is to bring your own hairdryer if that matters to you! Also they don't have tea or coffee making facilities which would have been nice to have had especially first thing in the morning!! But it was a lovely hotel and in an excellent location and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorkRose
Reviews.Content: A group of people from Cork, Ireland who were a visiting choir to Rome stayed at this hotel recently and everything about this hotel was excellent. The staff were most courteous and helpful. The most important thing is its location which is very central and convenient to all places of interest. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: japanesetourist
Reviews.Content: Great fun, great room and VERY close to all you would want to see, after our first day which was very bad in the Giada hotel this hotel was an oasis. The family and myself would recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Home in Sweet Rome”
Reviews.Author: RoulaMaria
Reviews.Content: I think that Hotel Hiberia is absolutely the best choice one could make considering an unforgettable stay in Rome. This charming place is ideally located in the heart of Rome (not kidding--if u look up Via Maggio XXIV on the map, u will find that it is exactly in the heart of the city!). The President''s house is right next door, so the security is guarranteed, and the Trevi fountain is two minutes away. The colosseum and historic rome is a10 min walk away, and so r the Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona. Other than the superb location, the hotel is very clean, neat, and designed to impress. The breakfast is also great, especially with a cup of real cappuccino! The receptionists are very friendly and helpful, and room service is very good, too. My husband and I have been to rome twice, and the second time in the Hotel Hiberia was even better than the first. I would definitely call it our home in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Our worst stay in Italy...”
Reviews.Author: ZeinaUAE
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the reception area, well its not as tiny as another reviewer made it sound & at least its bright and the staff seem very kind and helpful...but it fools you into thinking you have booked into a good hotel. Once check-in is over and you are handed the keys to your room, everything changes. I was shocked when the porter led us through a sliding door into the adjacent building which, according to him is 300 years old. By the looks of it, it didnt look like anything had been done to fix this place for 300 years!!!! It was dark, smelly and quite frankly I knew right away we made a mistake. I know and have been told that in Rome hotels are all quite old (my mom stayed at the Intercontinental a few months ago and she even said that was old and the room very small) but this was shocking as it did not seem well maintained at all. First of all, the elevator is the oldest i have ever seen....you need to close the gates and then the wooden doors for it to start. That was also very smelly. Our room was dark, dusty (i ran my finger across the desk and couldnt believe my eyes!) and it just simply made our stay uncomfortable. The bathroom is old and so noisy, it takes the toilet forever to become quiet again after you flush it.... using it in the middle of the night was very annoying especially because my husband and I kept waking each other up. The breakfast is also THE WORST breakfast we had in all of Italy. We had breakfast there the first morning and after that horrible, tasteless experience we ate breakfast at cafes for the rest of our stay. Even my husband who will literally eat anything thought it was bad! The ONLY good thing I can say about Hotel Hiberia is that the location is very practical and close to the Collosseum. We walked everywhere. You wont cry yourself to sleep every night but unless you are totally desperate for somewhere to stay, dont book it!!

Reviews.Title: “Find a Better Place”
Reviews.Author: LovinItaly07
Reviews.Content: The best that can be said is that the location is close to the Roman Forum and Collosseum, as well as good restaurants. Also, the car that was promised was waiting for us at the airport. Once at the hotel, however, things went downhill. The reception area is tiny, with no place to sit down and wait. The rooms are small, tiny in fact, dingy, and dark, and the bathroom was dingy and not entirely clean. The toilet in the room that my son and his friend shared did not flush. They reported it to the front desk, who promised to have someone look at it, three times, which did not ever happen. They had to go from their second floor room to the ground floor to use the facilities. The staff was polite enough, but seemingly ineffective. Towels and bedding were barely adequate, and both had a slightly slimy feel. We were thankfully there only one night. On a future visit, I would book a different hotel, possibly the Gardena across the street.

Reviews.Title: “very surprised”
Reviews.Author: jaqshar
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in the hotel for my birthday in april 2007 we were very surprised at the location being so central( within walking distance of most main attractions) We fell in love with Rome and will definately be back and would stay in the hotel again. We had breakfast which had hot and cold creads croissants eggs bacon sauage etc. We also had our first meal in the restaurant which we had pizza and pasta which was fabulous as was all of our meals in Rome my only complaint of the hotel would be that the pillows on the bed were rock hard but it was very clean the shower was great and the mini bar was reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan003
Reviews.Content: Always use this web site to research hotels, including The Hiberia, great service so decided to add my input. Wonderful hotel in a super location, only 10 minutes pleasant walk to Trevi Fountain and 20 mins to Coliseum. Staffs were very friendly and helpful plus the room was very spacious, clean, well decorated with a large modern bathroom. Breakfast was fine, self service, with usual pastries, meats and cheese plus sausage, bacon and scrambled eggs. It was served in the restaurant which on an evening serves pizzas. The mini bar was reasonable at 2 euros for a bottle of water/coke etc. I spent hours looking for the right hotel and I believe I found it, very clean, friendly and no need to take a bus or tube train anywhere. Took advice and booked tickets for Coliseum online, on arrival it is chaotic and unorganised. You have to go to the front of both lines and hand in your pass to receive your tickets (couter is on the right). The line on the right is for couples etc whilst the line on the left is for groups. The line for Vatican museums and Sistine Chapel is even longer however on reflection I think everyone arrives early (as suggested in the guide book). We waited 2 hours, from 9.30, however when we came out at 1pm it was raining and NOBODY was in a queue. If you want to see the Sistine Chapel then avoid Vatican City and Saint Peters (visit here afterwards). When you arrive at Saint Peters Square head east (right through the pillars) along a main street with shops etc (Via di Porta Angelica) eventually you will see some signs on lamp posts. Eating is expensive but was cheaper in the Trastevere area (other side of the river) we ate at Ristorante Galeassi in Piazza S. Maria - reasonable prices and wine not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a location”
Reviews.Author: Fallo7
Reviews.Content: This being our first trip to Rome, for our 10 year anniversary, my wife and I were delighted with the hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in May 07. The price was very reasonable and even got a discount though booking with Venere.com (tip:search for the discount code on the net). The hotels location is quite central to most of the tourist spots (Trevi, Forum, Coleseum). The rooms are narrow & small, but I beleive this is par for the course in Rome. We went for the standard double which was fine. The shower would knock you off of your feet and just remember not to put any foam gel in the jacuzzi bath!! The staff were very friendly and gave good advise when approached. There is a free tear-off A3 size map at reception, the only map you will need! We had breakfast in the room the first morning which consisted of a lot of breads, croissants, cheese, jam & coffee. I cannot comment on the breakfast room as we tended to hit the cafes on our morning excursions. The hotel also has a tiny little bar that you can get cocktails, spirits or coffee but it is not always manned. We used it once just before it closed at midnight. You're better off going to some of the local cafe bars in the vicinty if you want a late drink. We never tried the restaurant attached to the hotel although the menu did look good. There was a fabulous local restaurant around the corner called the Lantern where all the locals seem to go. As to the sight seeing, we found Discover Rome tours (english speaking) an excellent bunch of people and very informative. You usually find them outside the Coleseum and they have 4 or 5 really good tours at a reasonable price. No matter how much you read up on Rome through the guide books, guided local information is always better. I'll definitely be back to Rome and I would not be disappointed if I had to stay in the Hibernia!!

Reviews.Title: “great mid price hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinYvonne
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this hotel , it was very well located, in safe area, the rooms were small but spotlessly clean. The Staff very pleasant and helpful. I would return. Yvonne - Dublin - 15.3.07

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location!”
Reviews.Author: monkeyboy22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hiberia for 3 days at the end of February and loved it. The best part of the hotel was the staff, they were fantastic-- very helpful and excellent English. The room was very nice and super clean. The breakfast in the morning was great, good pastry and cappucino. My only complaints were minor. The shower was a bit tight, but certainly manageable. My wife thought the blow dryer was terrible, so think about bringing your own. Like I said minor stuff. The location was great. The train station was about a 10 minute walk-- we did it with our luggage the first time, but after figuring out how great the bus system is, took the bus on the way out of town. The bus stop is a block away and the hotel has tickets. I think the times to the sights they list are a bit optimistic but everything is close. About 15 minutes to the Forum, maybe 7 or 8 to Trevi, and 10 or 12 to the Pantheon. Take bus 40 to St Peter's, it's super convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSGJ99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. It was our first time in Rome and we both fell in love with the place. This hotel certainly helped add to the wonderful time we had. The location is wonderful - just over a 5min walk to Trevi fountain and really well placed for everywhere else. The staff at the hotel where all really friendly and helpful. Not sure if the staff have changed from previous reviews which say they are rude, but anyway, i found them excellent. They gave us a good map and highlighted where everything was and pointed out the best walking routes. The room was a good size with an AMAZING shower and the mini bar was a welcome surprise (and not too expensive compared with others i have used). Didn't get a chance to experience breakfast but we did get a free drink in the bar when we arrived ts they weren't quite ready for us to check in. I would also recommend taking advantage of the coach service from the airport organised with the company Terrovision. For 14 euro each return, they drop you off and pick you up at the main train station which is close to this hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jacl
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel in a great location - walking distance to the trevi fountain and round the corner from where you can pick up the tourist buses. very helpful reception staff on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising & overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTravellerDublin
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel due to the good price relative to the location. So I checked our their site, and did indeed find a good special offer advertised, however when I contacted the hotel to inquire about the price, the one quoted was 2.3 times higher than the special offer. When I questioned this, "we must correct the error of before, special offer valid only 07/01 to 10/02/07". However site clearly and currently states "Special Offer From 07 th January 2007 to 31st january 2007" Watch out!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out!”
Reviews.Author: EscapingSeattle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hiberia for a week in early October. Hotel was pleasant, clean and in a great location. The problem is the lack of customer service. We had booked through Venere.com and given a 4% discount on the rates. At check-out, we were billed the full amount without the discount, and I did not notice this until arriving home in Seattle. I emailed the hotel about the problem asking for a refund on my Visa. I was told a credit was not possible, or at best would take "a very long time". I continued to insist on a credit to my Visa, and after a few angry responses from Danilo Petrucci at Hiberia, believed a credit would be coming. Two months later, no credit. Danilo has not responded to my latest emails. Hiberia would be a worthy choice in Rome if they were committed to a reasonable level of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Malady
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, you can walk easily to Colleseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps. Train station isn't too far away, plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. The staff were very helpful and there was always someone at the front desk. The room, although clean & tidy, was very small for us (family of 4) however most of the time we were out exploring. A little bit noisy at night time but close the windows and it's fairly quiet. If we ever go back to Rome which I hope we will, I'd be happy to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Nosus
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel in an amazing city. The people at reception had average English and between this and my pathetic Italian we got on fine!The reception is nice with a tiny bar at the back. The elevator shaft is scary to say the least!It looks like its been there since the age of Gladiators but it works ok! However the rooms are extremely clean with a television (all Italian channels) and mini-bar and are very spacious. The bathroom was lovely with a fantastic power-shower - Just perfect after a day's shopping or sightseeing in the Eternal City!There are Versace tiles all over and the room had marble floors.Whether these are real or fake-it doesn't matter-they give a very exclusive impression. The breakfast did leave it down.It was in a horrible dining room next door and it really wasn't great. It was included in the price so better have something small to eat perhaps a croissant and coffee just to be satisfied. It is 5 minutes from the trevi Fountain and about 10 minutes from the Vittorio Emmanuelle and 15 from the Collesseum. Its a really central location. We spent 6 days there and would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Consider staying in a one more star hotel in Rome.....”
Reviews.Author: Wishes3
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, which was about 230 Euro per night, I think we should have shopped more and considered a hotel with one more star. They write beautifully and you get the impression that the attention is wonderful. When you get there, the attention is not so great, and they are a bit indifferent. We told them in the letters as we were booking that it was our honeymoon. Do you think that at least we could have gotten a "congratulations". It was not even acknowledged. The services that they researched for us came with a big price tag. We got a significantly better deal renting a car ourselves at the Termini station, rather than the "best price" that they offered us. Pros: Clean room, good location, Definitely take the 50 Euro transportation that they offer from the airport, sufficiently nice for traveling with light luggage Cons: Don't expect any extra attention, or assistance for touring ideas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Laughibly small room”
Reviews.Author: cattykitty
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Its two kilometres from termini station. (we walked it) Its right around the corner from the Quirinale, and trevi fountain is a few minutes away. Good Points: The hotel is very clean, the windows shut tight (very important in Rome for noise reasons. The shower had a seat :D...the room had a safe. As above the location was very good. We had a lie in on the second day and unlike most hotels they didnt walk in on top of us to clean the room, but it was always done up when we came back from a long day trekking around rome. We had a bit of a laugh on the last night sitting at the hotel bar (small corner rather than bar),with one of the staff and his mate, and when I woke up hungover the next day, the guy on reception took pity on me and drew me a map of where to get the bus to the station. Bad points: The room was incredibly laughably small. There was hardly any room to walk around the bed. In fact we had to crawl over it to get passed each other. The room itself was a bit dark, and unless you sat down on the seat in the shower it was liable to flood the bathroom. The only english news channel on the tele was Fox news... Generally Rome, and indeed Italy, is very expensive for what you get. I paid over 200 Euro a night for this hotel. For what you would get at home the standard is incomparable. Rome hotels are very similar to good quality hostels at home, I find. I think they have a very different star rating than western europe. By Irish standards this hotel would be a 1, pushing a 2 star. Ive been to rome three times and the hotels are pretty much all like this unless you stay out a little further from the centre. I think alot of western europeans and american first time rome explorers expect the same service as we would get at home. Its not like that. I personally like the Roman's, but they can be a bit gruff and abrupt and wont fall over you. Possibly the result of hundreds of years of tourists! Would I stay there again if I happened on Rome, maybe not, but thats not to say that another hotel wouldnt be the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: =^-^=Hkitty13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fantastic. The location is in the very heart of Rome. 5 mins walk to Trevi Fountain, 10mins walk to Colosseum, 15 mins walk to Spanish Steps, 1 min to the Quirinale. The staff are extremely helpful. Breakfast is great...scrambled eggs, bacon, salami, cheese, cereal, rolls, pastries and even posh coffee - a real great start to the day. There was 6 of us and we had a really lovely fancy room with a jacuzzi bath and the shower was the best ever. It had massaging sprays so after a lovely stroll and walk, this was the great way to end your day. I definitely recommend this hotel to both young and old as the location is fab!! There's a McDonalds 10mins away for those that want a quick fast food bite and there are lots of restaurants too. Those that want to shop, Nazionale is round the corner for those that want to buy some last minute clothes. Ice Cream is the best and there are lots of these near the hotel. We booked our taxi to CIA from the hotel as this was 50 Euro and cheaper. Weather was great...sunny and hot! We will definitely come back to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet & Central”
Reviews.Author: IntentionalTourist
Reviews.Content: The Hiberia is a very centrally located hotel in the ancient part of Rome (near to the Coliseum, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, etc.). It is located a half block from the Piazza del Quirinale and is easy walking distance (if you don't mind some hills) to most of the major attractions excluding Vatican City. The opened top red tour bus (the most convenient and cost effective way to see the sites of Rome) stops at the corner just down from the hotel, which is very convenient when you have sore feet -- like every day. This hotel was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The room had no view and was no more cramped than your average New York hotel, which is fine since we really didn't spend much time in it. The hotel staff was quasi-friendly and the front desk spoke English (as did many Italians). I'd read other reviews here that panned their breakfast and coffee, but our experience was fine with fresh espresso or cappucino available on request. All in all this was a very good 3 star hotel in the city center and Rome is an amazing collection of thousands of years of history. I recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy and weird”
Reviews.Author: J'aimeLaFrance
Reviews.Content: The room was shabby (worn chairs, drapes, walls), small for the price, shower had some odd jacuzzi thing that obviously didn't work anymore with a gross old showerhead and the shower doors didn't close (there was another showerhead that worked and at least there was hot water). It was pretty quiet however, and the AC worked well. The building was very odd. The lobby is normal enough (pay internet on one machine) but then you go through automatic doors down two stairs, then up four to go to a rattle trap lift. Yes, old building, I know. But the hotel appears to only be in one section on each floor - the rest of the building is offices and residences. When you come back down, unless you walk right up to the automatic doors (that are not see-through) you can't even tell how to get out/back to the lobby. Like I said, weird and not in a good, quirky way. I had issues adjusting a booking on venere.com - piece of advice, when traveling with others, book each room on a separate reservation. If any changes, you can just adjust the one room. Also, contacting the hotel directly did not work - they 'could not see or access the reservation made on venere'. Odd, since they would have to see it eventually?? We ended up having to call twice, email and then cancel the whole reservation online. Then when I showed up, they said it still wasn't cancelled and charged a no-show fee. That's another story/battle for later. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes from Everything!”
Reviews.Author: SJhulawahine
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay here earlier this month. I communicated directly with the hotel via email and always received prompt & courteous responses. We opted for a quad room which was perfect for 4 adults and about 5 small luggages! Everyone at this property was so friendly and helpful! It is located just minutes from Trevi, Colosseum, Forum, Pantheon and Spanish Steps. Only 2 small 'complaints' while we were there. We were there during the recent heat wave and the A/C was not working properly. In fact, it started dripping in the middle of the night so we had to put a towel underneath the drip to avoid any wetting the carpet. It seemed common since there were a couple more drips in the hallway as we were leaving. The other thing was the bath/shower. They had these 1/2 doors (accordian style) which do nothing to prevent water from dripping onto the floor as you're taking a shower. They could easily resolve this by changing to shower curtains or putting a full "door" for the bath. But as I said, these are just 2 miinor things. Breakfast was included so we were able to fill up on toast, pastries, coffee, hot cocoa, cereal, ham slices, etc. Internet is available in the back. I believe it was 1 euro for 12 minutes. If we come back to Rome, I'll be back to Hotel Hiberia! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: VeedonFleece
Reviews.Content: Just got round to posting this review, but I thought that I used Tripadvisor so much before I went to Rome that I need to give something back. This is a great hotel, in terms of location you are so close to everything, the Trevi is 5 minutes, the Roman Forum 10 minutes. Staff are very helpful, we were given a room on the 4th floor and the views were fab. Tips: 1.Don't go near the Coliseum unless you have bought a ticket from the Kiosk on Palatine Hill, if you do you will by pass all the queues and walk straight in. 2. Be at the Vatican for no later than 8:30 and if you wish to go to see the Cistine Chapel, get up about 4:00. The queues are mad and life is too short. 3. At the vatican, arrive at St. Peters for 9:00 or so and climb to the dome before you see inside the church 4. Villa Borgese is great for picnic 5. Cafe Greco for a coffee, street opposite the Spanish Steps. Casanova had coffee there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hiberia - EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: travelrew
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 2 nights / 3 days in Rome at the end of a 14 day cruise through the Eastern Med. Hotel Hiberia exceeded all experiences I've had in European hotels. From the time I was greeted at the front desk, until I checked out, I can't say enough wonderful things about not only the staff, but the accommodations and the location as well. I arrived 4 hours earlier than planned, and after being invited back to the coffee bar for a refreshment (Danilo - the owner - makes the best capuccino in Rome!), and more waiting, they decided to assign a different room and had me checked in by 11:00 am. The double room was very cool, clean, spacious, and included A/C. I was a solo traveller, but the hotel had numerous families with children. I chose the hotel because of location - 15 minutes to Coloseo; Trevi, Pantheon, Spanish Steps; 5 minutes to the Roman Forum, Trajan's Column and Market; and just down the street from the Presidential Palace. Danilo and staff - I salute you in making my stay in your City so comfortable and welcoming. Raylene Weis, Atlanta Georgia ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ Hotel Hiberia Address : Via Ventiquattro Maggio 8 00187 - Roma Email : hiberia@venere.com Fax n. : +39-06-6794600 Phone n. : +39-06-6782662 cc: Hotel Hiberia

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a room, even with Reservations!!”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading all the great reviews. Had reservations for two nights for my first trip to Rome with my boyfriend. After arriving late Friday evening, we walked from Termini Station with all our bags only to be greeted with "Sorry, our power went out on the top floor, so we have to put you up in another hotel." I was upset at first, but they paid for a taxi to pick us up and take us to the other hotel (which ended up being back near the Termini station). Then, overcharged me (but refunded right away). Would love to have stayed with you, Hiberia, but unfortunately it did not work out.

Reviews.Title: “Visit with Caution”
Reviews.Author: TP111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our three, late teen and young adult children spent 5 nights at the Hiberia Hotel in Rome. The location of the hotel is indeed terrific as it is central to most of the ancient part of Rome and all of the major attractions. The staff is for the most part fluent in English and can help quite easily with directions, checking in and checking out. Recommendations for restaurants resulted in one great suggestion and one poor one (After which we went off on our own). Directions on getting buses was poor, but they are very efficient at getting cabs on short notice. The rooms are clean and generally well furnished. Our major problem was that we arrived to find that the two deluxe rooms (with individual bathrooms) that we had reserved were not available and instead were given the standard rooms which are tiny and shared one bathroom. We were moved the next day to Deluxe rooms, but were not given much of a refund for the difference in the rooms the first night. This was in spite of confirmatory emails from the travel agency and the hotel itself. We had to argue for a refund of the difference in price of the rooms. Then, when we checked out, the manager tried to charge us about 300 Euros more than the agreed on price for the 5 nights, until I pulled out the email with the confirmed price. The breakfast was the worst we had in Italy (we had great food in the other two hotels). Coffee was bitter and from a machine, the meats were warm and did not seem fresh. Fruit was non-existent, and the staff was rude. Fruit juice was also dispensed from a machine. Overall, location was good, but we would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Corina1231
Reviews.Content: Great location! Beautiful view from our window. Our room was a good size and very clean. Unfortunately, the air conditioning wasn't working very well in our room. The hotel offered to move us to another room the following morning. My husband could not sleep and decided to change hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for the Hiberia and Italy”
Reviews.Author: lucky2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hiberia Hotel on XXIV Maggio in late June with our three (recent) college grads. The Hiberia is in a fantastic location within walking distance of the Trevi, Spanish Steps, Forum, and many other major sites. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They recommended excellent restaurants, gave countless directions in fluent English, and called taxis that came immediately (it is not easy getting a taxi for 5 out in the city). The neighborhood is wonderful - cafes and pubs, shops, and a bus stop on the corner. The open-air bus was fun to do. The temperature outside was very hot, but the hotel air conditioning was just right and was a very welcome relief. Our 3-person and 2-person deluxe rooms were clean, had good beds and service, reasonably priced minibar and included a safe for valuables. The bathrooms were modern and nicely designed. We want to say thank you to all of the staff and especially Danilo Petrucci for helping to give our family a wonderful and very memorable trip that we will talk about for years to come. We also want them to know we rooted for Italy in the World Cup! Hooray!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: thenati
Reviews.Content: My family recently had a pleasant stay of 4 nights at Hotel Hiberia. Hotel is quaint, Quad room was plenty big enough for 4 people. My wife and I had a qween and our 12 and 16 year old each had a single bed in another room seperated by a sliding curtain. Room was clean and bathroom newly remodeled. Water pressure and temperature were excellent and ac worked fine. Staff at the front desk friendly and spoke excellent English. The breakfast was just ok. Typical continental, but what made it worse was fresh fruit was an apple and the worst coffee I had ever tasted and came from a machine. The juice was also from a machine. They do have a cappacino machine behind the small bar area if you prefer that but you must ask. We did not use but there is a small breakfast carry out directly across the street. The best feature was the location. This was important to us. We could walk to all major attractions. The only metro bus we took was a 15 minute ride to Vatican City for a tour. Also took about a mile and a half bus ride to the train termini. We took the train to Venice and had our luggage otherwise we could have walked to termini. I recommend the hotel pickup at the airport upon arrival. The minibus was 60 euro and worth the hassel of not knowing where we were going.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Family at the Hiberia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hiberia Hotel met all of our needs and expectations. We were looking for a hotel to accomodate a family of four (2 boys ages 9 & 12). We needed it to be comfortable, clean, friendly, affordable and in a good location. We had a quad room - two rooms separated by an archway with curtain. The bathroom was large and newly remodeled. The airconditioning (which we needed) worked well. The maid came every day and was patient with our jetlag. The front desk was helpful with all of our questions. And the best thing was the location. We walked everywhere. The Forum, Colosseum, Pantheon, Palatine Hill were all 10 minutes from our door. And be sure to walk down every alley you see... you never know what wonderful piazza, cafe, or gelateria you might find.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: Finandarragh
Reviews.Content: Mixed experience at this hotel . Booked taxi transfer from Ciampino airport and as promised the taxi was waiting outside arrivals hall , a good start . When we arrived at the hotel we were told that we would have one room for the first night of our stay and then would have to move the next morning to a different room. What annoyed me most was the attitude , an apology would have gone a long way. The room we were given the first night was of a higher standard than the one we booked but we couldn't unpack which was a bit of a pain . The rooms were fairly basic and small but very clean with new towels each day . The people in the next room must have had too much pizza as we could hear them flushing the toilet loads of times during the night . Breakfast was good but if I was going back again I would go to the cafe across the street for delicious chocolate croissants, great coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice for 5 euros each . We were able to walk to most of the sites although we kept getting lost , our poor map reading didn't help ! There's a good theatre bar round the corner for that late at night last drink and they had a brilliant blues band playing on Saturday night. We had a fantastic time in Rome , the hotel was fine but you could maybe get something better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews for me...”
Reviews.Author: adragonne
Reviews.Content: I reserved on the Hiberia based on reviews from this site but found it a little overrrated. Booked a double deluxe but the only "deluxe" we got was the room size which by european standards was large. Bathroom tiles and showerheads seem quite new and we liked that. No view besides a crummy little window overlooking a boring alley. Nothing like the pictures we saw at Venere. Breakfast was well assorted (again for european standards) but coffee was lame. Good location for walking but hard to get to metro stations. Hotel is in a very busy street but in-room noise was not a problem (except for the ocassional loud neighbor). Found it too expensive for overall satisfaction, we would no stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: Clive197
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of these reviews and were not disappointed. It really is in a great location an easy walk to the Palatine, Colosseum, Trevi fountain and the rest of the historic centre. Traditional looking from the outside the hotel is smart and the rooms comfortable and clean. Although there is no restaurant there is a little bar which serves excellent coffee after a late night out on the town. Breakfast is great by European standards with a good mix of pastry’s, cheeses and breads etc. Staff speak English and are always helpful, and the room was serviced immaculately. They emailed us to offer an airport taxi service which although perhaps more expensive than arranging it yourself was welcome and was waiting for us at the airport as arranged. Hard to fault!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, conveniently located, good price”
Reviews.Author: letsmakeadeal
Reviews.Content: We were quite happy with Hotel Hiberia and will return. We stayed with our two children in a very comfortable room for four. Good beds. The location was great: We walked from the hotel to Piazza del Popolo, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and the Trinita dei Monti, Trastevere, Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori, the Jewish Quarter. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was continental -- selection was OK but not great but it was very convenient to have it downstairs. More important, if you asked, they made great capuccino and espresso for you. The staff emailed us to see if we wanted a car to pick us up at the airport for 50 euros (for 4 people, it would have been almost as much had we taken the train to Termini and taken a taxi) which was very nice. The price at 180 euro a night was reasonable for a big city in Europe. Our only complaint was that, like in many European hotels, the bath was retrofitted with a shower and while the shower was very good, the system for keeping in the water was not great and the bathroom floor was wet every morning. [It was clean each evening when we returned].

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hiberia Hotel. It was in a nice location to catch the bus to get around the city. Plus you could walk about anywhere except Vatican City. I would stay there again. It was not high class but that is what made it special. If you like fancy places this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hibernia for a short week in March 2006. Hotel is well situated at the foot of the Quirinale hill, short distance to Piazza Venezia, Forum Romanum etc. Our room was showing a bit of wear, the showerhead partly clogged etc. Also, we were woken early on two occasions due to construction work going on in the building. Staff were english speaking, in general helpful and supplied a baby cot for our son. The hotel breakfast is nothing special (stale bread and tasteless coffee from a machine), and we ended up taking breakfast in the neigbourhood coffee bars instead. In sum, this hotel is convenient for a short stay but could be better.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: snuggle
Reviews.Content: 8 of us have just come back from a weekend stay at the Hotel Hiberia. I had chosen it after reading glowing reports! Wow it was in a perfect location. We spend 2 and half days walking around all the sights of Rome. The rooms we had were on the 2nd floor. It was imaculate, the bathroom looked brand new, with a jet system shower, it was all sparkling & clean. Rooms were fab, very clean, comfy, just perfect. Go on book it you won't regret it! x

Reviews.Title: “Go to Rome--Skip the HIberia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two college-aged children just got back from 2 weeks and 4 different hotels in Italy. The Hiberia was by far the worst hotel we stayed at. We arrived on Christmas eve, and after having made reservations months in advance, it felt like we got the worst room at the inn. My kids described it as "Harry Potter's closet". It was a smallish room with two cots added as an afterthought--far smaller than the "Adult Quad" room I was expecting. The low, curved ceiling was likely the result of the room being tucked under the staircase. The small window gave out onto a view of a dirty alley. The heater worked sporadically. The housekeeping service was lackluster. We had to step around cots to get to the bathroom. The staff was of little or no help. I chose this hotel based in part on the glowing reviews of other customers and its location in the center of Rome. For my family of four, this hotel was clearly the worst of our stay. Find another place nearby and skip the headaches.

Reviews.Title: “Hiberia is a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazzers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hiberia Hotel for three nights following a cruise. Having read many reviews of many hotels in Rome, we decided on this hotel based on customer satisfaction and location. We were pleasantly surprised, to say the least! The staff were knowledgeable, friendly and spoke English. They welcomed us as if to their own home. The room was ready even though we were 3 hours ahead of check-in. The rooms are on the second floor, which is the first floor in Rome. We went up a tiny elavator and thought, oh, no what have we gotten ourselves into!! However, the room was huge by European standards. There was a king sized bed in the middle of a very large room. There was an armoir to put clothes into and sufficient hangers. The television received many channels, however, only two in English. One of those was FOX news so we were able to keep up with the news. The bathroom was also huge, and had a jacuzzi shower! Everything was spotless. The bed was firm but very comfortable after a day of walking. They provide a European breakfast consisting of coffee, tea or hot chocolate, orange or grapefruit juice, meats, cheeses, rolls and sweet breads. In the evening it is a pizza restaurant. Everyone was friendly and helpful. They arranged our transfer to the airport and all went well. This hotel speaks of being within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. This is true. You must, however, experiment with various ways to get back to the hotel unless you enjoy walking up a very steep hill. All of the Rome attractions are within walking distance of the hotel, if you enjoy walking. There is a subwy (Metro) about a five minute walk away and the subway is easy to use. There are coffee shops around the corner from the hotel and they are not expensive like the ones near the fountain. This is a hotel we will definitely return to. The cost was 146 Euros a night and well worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Danilo Petrucci-thank you!”
Reviews.Author: chelseatraveller121
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome in the middle of the night at the worst hotel- the Castellino Palio Blanco. We were offered a not very clean room in the attic with no window and we panicked....the night porter was sympathetic and transfered us to the Hiberia. The night manager from the Hiberia was fantastic- Danilo Petrucci. He collected us in his own car and the room was super and Mr Petrucci was so professional. He recommended good little 'out of the way restaurants'and knew everything about Rome. He even collected a letter from the Palio Blanco when a dispute with our travel agency occured. This hotel is in a good location and i would strongly recommend it! What started off as a nightmare resulted in a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Omey23
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Rome so a central location was a 'must'. This hotel was in a great position with all the key attractions within easy walking distance. Trevi Fountain 5 mins walk, Roman Forum 10 mins & Colosseo 15 mins. The bus to the Vatican was accross the road. Parts of the hotel have been refurbished. We had a family quad room (120) which was very comfortable and large with a king size bed & 2 singles. You can here traffic noise in the room as most Roman streets are cobbled, this wasn't a major problem. Apart from a small drip in the bathroom ceiling and not so powerful air con the room accomodation matched many U.S. style standards. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Beware of prices charged by taxi drivers as the price charged is not what they quote before setting off. The hotel can arrange better priced airport transfers and you pay at reception

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonWinnipeg7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, intimate and friendly. The hotel staff were very helpful in providing directions, sugesting sites to visit, restaurants,shopping and a host of other ideas and suggestions a tourist would get in a 5+star hotel at a much higher price.Basically this hotel made us feel at home and important. Our room, although not large, was clean and comfortable and our room was on the 4th floor with a view of some of the city.Location was important to us. When booking a hotel we wanted to be as central as possible and within a reasonable walking distance to some of Rome's popular attractions, shopping and dining. This hotel was a perfect location for us,about a 15min walk to the Roman ruins and Colosseum, 5 min to theTrevi Fountain, 10 min to the Spanish steps and of course there is plenty of shopping and dining again within minutes to satisfy any one's needs.
